pera: <entryFree id="n34596" type="greek" key="pe_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ph)ra</foreign>, <sense id="n34596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wallet</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">mantica, loculus): peras imposuit Juppiter nobis duas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum baculo perāque senex, of a Cynic philosopher,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:53:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 53, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 287, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:17:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 17, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perabjectus: <entryFree id="n34597" type="main" key="pe^rabjectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-abjectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n34597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deeply humbled</hi>, Cypr. Laud. Mart. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perabsurdus: <entryFree id="n34598" type="main" key="pe^rabsurdus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-absurdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very absurd</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec quia videntur perabsurda, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 15, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 11, 30</bibl>.—Separated: <cit><quote lang="la">per enim absurdum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; v. per, II. D.</sense></entryFree>
peraccommodatus: <entryFree id="n34599" type="hapax" key="pe^raccommo^da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-accommŏdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very convenient</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per fore accommodatum tibi, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peracer: <entryFree id="n34600" type="main" key="pe^ra_cer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ācer</orth>, <itype>ācris, ācre</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very sharp;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 4</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 1</bibl>, the correct reading is cor acre; v. Ritschl ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
peracerbus: <entryFree id="n34601" type="main" key="pe^ra^cerbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ăcerbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very harsh</hi> to the taste. </sense><sense id="n34601.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva peracerba gustatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34601.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very painful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi peracerbum fuit, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peracesco: <entryFree id="n34602" type="main" key="pe^ra^cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ăcesco</orth>, <itype>ăcŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n34602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become sour through and through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoroughly sour;</hi> hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">to become vexed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow vexatious</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">ita mihi pectus peracuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc, hoc est, quod peracescit: hoc est demum quod percrucior,</quote> <trans><tr>that vexes me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peractio: <entryFree id="n34603" type="main" key="pe^racti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕractĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perago</etym>, <sense id="n34603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a finishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34603.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: peccati, Hilar. in Psa. 118, 4, 8.—</sense><sense id="n34603.2" n="II" level="1"> Aetatis, transf. from the stage, qs. <hi rend="ital">the last act of the drama</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 85</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 64</bibl>: fabulam aetatis peregisse, and 19, 70: peragenda fabula est).</sense></entryFree>
peractus: <entryFree id="n34604" type="main" key="pe^ractus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perago.</entryFree>
peracute: <entryFree id="n34605" type="main" key="pe^ra^cu_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrăcūtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. peracutus <sense id="n34605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
peracutus: <entryFree id="n34606" type="main" key="pe^ra^cu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ăcūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very sharp.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34606.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">falx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:24:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 24, 5</bibl></cit> (dub.).—</sense><sense id="n34606.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of sound, <hi rend="ital">very clear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">penetrating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:241" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 241</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34606.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <pb n="1333" /> <cb n="PERA" /> <hi rend="ital">very keen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very acute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very penetrating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum peracutus esset ad excogitandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:39:145" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 39, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 76, 264</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:44:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 44, § 108</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrăcūtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very sharply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very acutely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with great keenness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moveri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peracute querebare, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reperisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peradpositus: <entryFree id="n34607" type="main" key="pe^radpo^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕradpŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. perapp-.</entryFree>
peradulescens: <entryFree id="n34608" type="hapax" key="pe^ra^du^lescens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ădŭlescens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very young</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo peradulescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 21, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peradulescentulus: <entryFree id="n34609" type="hapax" key="pe^radu^lescentu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-adŭlescentŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, <sense id="n34609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very young man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peraea: <entryFree id="n34610" type="main" key="Pe^raea1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕraea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*perai/a</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">gh=</foreign>, the land beyond the sea or river; hence), <sense id="n34610.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A strip of land in Caria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">along the coast opposite to Rhodes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and subject to the Rhodians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35" default="NO" valid="yes">35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:18" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34610.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A part of Palestine beyond the Jordan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the capital of which was Gadara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 14, 15, § 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34611" type="main" key="Pe^raea2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕraea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*perai/a</foreign>. <sense id="n34611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Æolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony of the Mityleneans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 21, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peraedificatus: <entryFree id="n34612" type="main" key="pe^raedi^fi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-aedĭfĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">completely built</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peraequatio: <entryFree id="n34613" type="main" key="pe^raequa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕraequātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>peraequo</etym>, <sense id="n34613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making perfectly equal</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n34613.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similitudinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34613.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an equalizing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equal distribution</hi> of taxes, Cod. Th. 5, 4, 3.</sense></entryFree>
peraequator: <entryFree id="n34614" type="main" key="peraequa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peraequātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an equalizer</hi>, esp. of taxes, <hi rend="ital">an equal distributor</hi> (jurid. Lat.), Cod. Th. 13, tit. 11; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11</bibl>, tit. 57; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 361, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peraeque: <entryFree id="n34615" type="main" key="pe^raeque_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-aequē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n34615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quite equally</hi> or <hi rend="ital">evenly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hos numquam minus, ut peraeque ducerent dena milia HS ex melle recipere esse solitos,</quote> <trans><tr>on an average</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hoc peraeque in omni agro decumano reperietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:52:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 52, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum peraeque omnes, tum acerbissime Boeotii senserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terna milia peraeque in singulos menses,</quote> <trans><tr>uniformly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peraequo: <entryFree id="n34616" type="main" key="pe^raequo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-aequo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make quite equal</hi> (post-Aug.): octogenae stirpes ...septenos culeos peraequarent, <hi rend="ital">filled up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">yielded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produced</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:10" default="NO">3, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contracturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum lunari computatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peraestimo: <entryFree id="n34617" type="main" key="pe^raesti^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-aestĭmo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to esteem greatly</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 6, 29, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
peragito: <entryFree id="n34618" type="main" key="pe^ra^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ăgĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hunt about greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to harass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n34618.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34618.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementius peragitati ab equitatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetna majore vi peragitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:37" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34618.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to stir up</hi> any thing, esp. a liquid: <cit><quote lang="la">ut permisceatur medicamen rutabulo ligneo peragitare conveniet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:24:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 19, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34618.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34618.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peragitatur enim messis mense Maio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 47, § 169</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perago: <entryFree id="n34619" type="main" key="pe^ra^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ăgo</orth>, <itype>ēgi, actum</itype> (<sense id="n34619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> paragier, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Orig. 7, p. 1</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n34619.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To thrust through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierce through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfix</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Theseus latus ense peregit,</quote> <trans><tr>transpierced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ardenti quercu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:146" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 146</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">externa peragi dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:364" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 364</bibl></cit>.—Hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:37:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 37, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34619.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pass through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">freta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sol duodena peregit Signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 618</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34619.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To drive about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annoy</hi> a person or thing (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pecora peragens asilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 2</bibl></cit>: totum Sempronium usque eo perago, ut, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n34619.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To carry through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go through with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n34619.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: exsequor, conficio, patro): multum egerunt, qui ante nos fuerunt, sed non peregerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 64:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 64, 8</bibl></cit>: carmen tubā solā peregit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> ad Stat. Th. 11, 56</bibl> (Ann. v. 508 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">fabulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 19, 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 64</bibl> (and v. peractio): <cit><quote lang="la">comitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13</bibl></cit>. 210: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 653</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptum iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:188" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <trans><tr>to finish distributing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 362</bibl></cit>: mandata, Ov. <cb n="PERA" /> M. 7, 502: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem, vitam, aevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 485</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:640" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 640</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">to exhaust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot viros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 34</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/gein</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to pass one's life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:138" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 138</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quis non peractum esse cum Pompeio crederet?</quote> <trans><tr>that the war with Pompey is ended</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:53" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34619.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in jurid. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">reum,</quote> <trans><tr>to continue a prosecution till the defendant is condemned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 6, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to prosecute to the end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptus est reus, neque peractus, ob mortem opportunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34619.7" n="IV" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to work</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">work up</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n34619.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum,</quote> <trans><tr>to till</tr>, <tr>cultivate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:693" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 693</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum,</quote> <trans><tr>to digest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 60, 86, § 183</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34619.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">describe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatus peragit deinde postulata...Haec paucis verbis carminis concipiendique jurisjurandi mutatis peragit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis auspicia,</quote> <trans><tr>to mention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res pace belloque gestas,</quote> <trans><tr>to describe</tr>, <tr>treat of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum perago tecum pauca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res tenues, tenui sermone peractas,</quote> <trans><tr>delivered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peragrans: <entryFree id="n34620" type="main" key="pe^ra_^grans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrā^grans</orth>, v. peragro, II.</entryFree>
peragranter: <entryFree id="n34621" type="main" key="pe^ra_^granter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrā^granter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. peragro <sense id="n34621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
peragratio: <entryFree id="n34622" type="hapax" key="pe^ra_^gra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrā^grātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>peragro</etym>, <sense id="n34622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wandering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">travelling through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a traversing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 23, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peragratrix: <entryFree id="n34623" type="main" key="pe^ra_^gra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrā^grātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that wanders</hi> or <hi rend="ital">travels through</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">coelicolarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 588</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peragro: <entryFree id="n34624" type="main" key="pe^ra_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ā^gro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n34624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part.</hi> peragratus, in the <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> signif.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>per and ager</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to wander</hi> or <hi rend="ital">travel through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi>, etc. (class.; cf. percurro). </sense><sense id="n34624.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 258</bibl></cit>.—Of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus silvasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca avia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:926" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 926</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in peragrandā Aegypto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:93" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peragratis partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 19, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of sailing: <cit><quote lang="la">litora Liburnicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques Romanus qui et commercia ea et litora peragravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 11, § 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:7:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:10:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 10, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34624.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Dep.</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peragratus omnes Germaniae partes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:97:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 97, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34624.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spread through; to search through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne immensum peragravit mente animoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia omnes peragravit insulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 13, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus res gestae omnes gentes terrā marique peragrassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 35, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 22, 53</bibl>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">per</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator ita peragrat per animos hominum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gula peragrans,</quote> <trans><tr>a roving appetite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:16:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrăgranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in roving about</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peragror: <entryFree id="n34625" type="main" key="pe^ra^gror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrăgror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. peragro, I. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.</entryFree>
peralbus: <entryFree id="n34626" type="main" key="pe^ralbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-albus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very white</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 171, 10.</sense></entryFree>
peramans: <entryFree id="n34627" type="main" key="pe^ra^mans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ămans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [amo], <sense id="n34627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very loving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very fond</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo peramans semper nostri fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 8</bibl></cit>, b, 3.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ămanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very lovingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perofficiose et peramanter aliquem observare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peramarus: <entryFree id="n34628" type="main" key="pe^ra^ma_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ămārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n34628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very bitter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hostile</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perambulo: <entryFree id="n34629" type="main" key="pe^rambu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ambŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ramble through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go through; to traverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perambulate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n34629.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multas terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium cubilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universam insulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 13, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perambulatum Romanis legionibus Niphatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 93</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus perambulat artūs,</quote> <trans><tr>runs through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 135</bibl></cit>: recte necne crocum floresque perambulet Attae Fabula, si dubitem, <hi rend="ital">rightly trod the stage</hi> (which was sprinkled with perfumed waters and strewed with flowers), i. e. <hi rend="ital">was properly constructed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well written</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo perambulat,</quote> <trans><tr>the fame spreads through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n34629.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of a physician, <hi rend="ital">to visit</hi> patients in succession, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:16:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 16, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34629.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To walk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct one's self</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:67:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 67, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">100, 2</bibl>. <cb n="PERB" /></sense></entryFree>
peramicus: <entryFree id="n34630" type="greek" key="pe^ra^mi_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ămīcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very friendly</hi>, Auct. Itin. Alex. M. 56 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
peramoenus: <entryFree id="n34631" type="main" key="pe^ra^moenus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ămoenus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very pleasant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peramplus: <entryFree id="n34632" type="main" key="pe^ramplus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-amplus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very ample</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=109 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 109 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:2:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peranceps: <entryFree id="n34633" type="main" key="pe^ranceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-anceps</orth>, <itype>ĭpĭtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very doubtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very uncertain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 5, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peranguste: <entryFree id="n34634" type="main" key="pe^ranguste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrangustē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perangustus <sense id="n34634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perangustus: <entryFree id="n34635" type="main" key="pe^rangustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-angustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very narrow</hi> (good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">termini Macedoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrangustē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very narrowly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peranna: <entryFree id="n34636" type="main" key="Pe^ranna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕranna</orth>, i. q. Perenna, v. Anna.</entryFree>
peranno: <entryFree id="n34637" type="main" key="pe^ranno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕranno</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>per-annus</etym>, <sense id="n34637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to live through a year</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella nata non perannavit,</quote> <trans><tr>did not live a year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12, 6</bibl> (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
perantiquus: <entryFree id="n34638" type="main" key="pe^ranti_quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-antīquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very ancient</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:10:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 10, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 37, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 9, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perappositus: <entryFree id="n34639" type="main" key="pe^rappo^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-appŏsĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pĕradpŏs-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very suitable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apposite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 274</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perardeo: <entryFree id="n34640" type="main" key="pe^rarde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ardĕo</orth>, <itype>si, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n34640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to burn violently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 23, 404</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perarduus: <entryFree id="n34641" type="main" key="pe^rardu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ardŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very difficult</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi autem hoc perarduum est demonstrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:71:section=166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 71, § 166</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peraresco: <entryFree id="n34642" type="main" key="pe^ra_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-āresco</orth>, <itype>ārŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n34642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow very dry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:49:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 49, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perargutus: <entryFree id="n34643" type="main" key="pe^rargu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-argūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n34643.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Very shrill</hi> (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">tintinnabula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 247, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. p. 349</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34643.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Very acute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very witty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:45:167" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 45, 167</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peraridus: <entryFree id="n34644" type="main" key="pe^ra_ri^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ārĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very arid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:19:1" default="NO">2, 19, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perarmo: <entryFree id="n34645" type="main" key="pe^rarmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-armo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to arm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">equip well</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perarmatus exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:23" default="NO">23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum gladius perarmat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 6, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peraro: <entryFree id="n34646" type="main" key="pe^ra^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ăro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n34646.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to plough through; to traverse</hi> the sea: <cit><quote lang="la">pontum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 650" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 650</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34646.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34646.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To furrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rugis anilibus ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34646.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To furrow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scratch over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to injure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerebrum crebra vibice peraratum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34646.4" n="C" level="2"> To scratch letters with the style on a waxen tablet, <hi rend="ital">to write</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia perarans manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 455</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peraratae tabellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perarare carmina auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:24" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 5, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perasper: <entryFree id="n34647" type="main" key="pe^rasper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-asper</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very rough</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 14</bibl>: montes, Jul. Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 51.</sense></entryFree>
per: <entryFree id="n34648" type="main" key="pe^r2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-astūtŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very crafty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 219, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peraticum: <entryFree id="n34649" type="greek" key="pe^ra_ti^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrātĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peratiko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n34649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of the bdellium-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 9, 19, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peratim: <entryFree id="n34650" type="hapax" key="pe_ra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pērātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>pera</etym>, <sense id="n34650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by bags</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wallets</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peratim ductare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to cheat one out of the money in his wallet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perattente: <entryFree id="n34651" type="main" key="pe^rattente_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrattentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perattentus <sense id="n34651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perattentus: <entryFree id="n34652" type="main" key="pe^rattentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-attentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very attentive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:5:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrattentē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very attentively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 11, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peratticus: <entryFree id="n34653" type="hapax" key="pe^ratti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-attĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very Attic</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">very elegant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 2, 1</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
peraudiendus: <entryFree id="n34654" type="spur" key="pe^raudi^endus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-audĭendus</orth>, <itype>a, um, false reading for perhaurienda</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 34</bibl>.</entryFree>
perbacchor: <entryFree id="n34655" type="main" key="perbacchor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-bacchor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n34655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a</hi>:, <hi rend="ital">to carouse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">revel through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 104</bibl></cit>: annum suum in re publicā, Ps. -<bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Decl. in Sall. 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34655.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of fire: <cit><quote lang="la">perbacchata domos incendia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 242</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perbasio: <entryFree id="n34656" type="main" key="perba_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-bāsĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to kiss heartily</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 41, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perbeatus: <entryFree id="n34657" type="main" key="perbe^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-bĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very fortunate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perbelle: <entryFree id="n34658" type="main" key="perbelle_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-bellē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n34658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very prettily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very finely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feceris, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 4</bibl></cit>, b, § 1.</sense></entryFree>
perbene: <entryFree id="n34659" type="main" key="perbe^ne^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-bĕnĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n34659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandi perbene, Potavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 81</bibl></cit>: pol ego <pb n="1334" /> <cb n="PERC" /> haud a pecuniā perbene, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui Latine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:28:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 28, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fortunam fecisse, quando, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perbenemeritus: <entryFree id="n34660" type="gloss" key="perbe^ne^me^ri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-bĕnĕ-mĕrĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very well deserved</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1923, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perbenevolus: <entryFree id="n34661" type="main" key="perbe^ne^vo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-bĕnĕvŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very friendly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perbenigne: <entryFree id="n34662" type="main" key="perbe^nigne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-bĕnignē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n34662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very kindly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 68</bibl>.—Separate: <cit><quote lang="la">per mihi benigne respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perbibesia: <entryFree id="n34663" type="spur" key="Perbi^be^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Perbĭbĕsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae, a false reading for Bibesia</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 74</bibl>.</entryFree>
perbibo: <entryFree id="n34664" type="main" key="perbi^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-bĭbo</orth>, <itype>bĭbi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (to drink much; hence), * <sense id="n34664.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To drink</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suck up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at ego perii, cui medullam lassitudo perbibit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34664.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To drink in</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n34664.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana quosdam (colores) non perbibit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34664.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to imbibe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum persuasi mihi et perbibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalia studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 36:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequitiam, id. Ira, 1, 16, 2: mentes eorum penitus sucum stultitiae perbiberunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:233" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinum sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perbito: <entryFree id="n34665" type="main" key="perbi_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-bīto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n34665.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go over</hi> to a place (ante - class.), Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 153, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam te ... malo cruciatu in Siciliam perbiteres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34665.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To perish</hi>: ne fame perbitat, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 153, 28</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 3 Rib.); so, fame, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 391, 22</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 61 Rib.); Enn. and Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 153, 26</bibl> and 30 (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:v. 240" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. v. 240</bibl> Vahl.; <cit><quote lang="la">Com. Rel. p. 117 Rib.): qui per virtutem perbitat, non interit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 32</bibl></cit> dub. (Fleck. perit, at): <cit><quote lang="la">cruciatu maximo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: perbitere Plautus pro perire posuit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=215" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 215</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
perblande: <entryFree id="n34666" type="main" key="perblande_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perblandē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perblandus <sense id="n34666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perblandus: <entryFree id="n34667" type="main" key="perblandus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-blandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very courteous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">charming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very engaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very bland</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">successor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 705</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perblandē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very winningly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem salutare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perbonus: <entryFree id="n34668" type="main" key="perbo^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-bŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very good</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam sei curabeis, perbona'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toreumata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perbono loco res erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perbrevis: <entryFree id="n34669" type="main" key="perbre^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-brĕvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very brief</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator perornatus et perbrevis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:43:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 43, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perbrevi tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:9:section=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 9, § 22</bibl></cit>.—Separate: <cit><quote lang="la">altera pars per mihi brevis videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">perbrevi, adverbially,</quote> <trans><tr>in a very short time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perbrĕ-vĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very concisely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sentiam, perbreviter exponam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:235 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 235 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
perbullio: <entryFree id="n34670" type="main" key="perbulli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-bullĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi and ii, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n34670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to boil thoroughly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perca: <entryFree id="n34671" type="greek" key="perca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/rkh</foreign>, <sense id="n34671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a perch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 24, § 57</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 9, 34, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:126" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 10, 44, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:145" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:112" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percaedo: <entryFree id="n34672" type="main" key="percaedo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-caedo</orth>, <itype>cĕcīdi, caesum</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut up completely</hi> = ad internecionem caedere (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:20:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 20, 10</bibl></cit>. (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">al. cecidit): terga hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percalefacio: <entryFree id="n34673" type="main" key="perca^le^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-călĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum</itype> (also contr. percalfactum), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>—<sense id="n34673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-călĕfīo</orth>, <itype>factus, fieri</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to make very warm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to heat thoroughly</hi> (mostly ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia motu Percalefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebae a sole percalefactae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo igni percalfacto cubiculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percalefieri cogit aquam,</quote> <trans><tr>to become very warm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percalefio: <entryFree id="n34674" type="main" key="perca^le^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percălĕfīo</orth>, <itype>fieri</itype>, v. percalefacio.</entryFree>
percalesco: <entryFree id="n34675" type="main" key="perca^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-călesco</orth>, <itype>călŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n34675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become very warm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde ubi percaluit vis venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 281</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 418</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percalleo: <entryFree id="n34676" type="main" key="percalleo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-calleo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to know</hi> or <hi rend="ital">understand well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque et viginti gentium linguas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:17:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percallesco: <entryFree id="n34677" type="main" key="percallesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-callesco</orth>, <itype>callŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n34677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n34677.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become very hardened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very callous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis patientia percalluerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 28, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34677.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get a good knowledge of;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be well acquainted with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to know well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be well versed in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:34:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 34, 137</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinas Stoicas et dialecticas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22</bibl></cit>, <cb n="PERC" /> 7: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 20, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque et viginti gentium linguas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:17:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percandefacio: <entryFree id="n34678" type="main" key="percande^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-candĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make very hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to heat thoroughly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percandidus: <entryFree id="n34679" type="main" key="percandi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-candĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very white</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:19:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 19, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percarus: <entryFree id="n34680" type="main" key="perca_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very dear.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34680.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very dear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very costly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34680.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very dear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very much beloved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eis vicissim percarus et jucundus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Aem. Scaur. 17, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:12:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 12, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percautus: <entryFree id="n34681" type="main" key="percautus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cautus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very cautious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6, § 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percedo: <entryFree id="n34682" type="gloss" key="perce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n34682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedit, cessit, percedit, percessit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perceleber: <entryFree id="n34683" type="main" key="perce^le^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cĕlĕber</orth>, <itype>bris, bre</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very celebrated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum vetustate et religione percelebre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percelebro: <entryFree id="n34684" type="main" key="perce^le^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cĕlĕbro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to practise</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">very frequently.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34684.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut exercerent, ut gererent, ut percelebrarent haec mala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34684.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to pronounce frequently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have often in one's mouth</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">de quā muliere plurimi versus totā Siciliā percelebrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:31:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 31, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervulgata et percelebrata sermonibus res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:29:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 29, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perceler: <entryFree id="n34685" type="main" key="perce^ler"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cĕler</orth>, <itype>celĕris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very quick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">swift</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 24, 58</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">percĕlerĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very soon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percello: <entryFree id="n34686" type="main" key="percello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cello</orth>, <itype>cŭli, culsum, 3</itype> (perculsi for perculi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 8, 13</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf.: procella, celer</etym>, <sense id="n34686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beat down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw down; to overturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upset</hi> (class.; syn.: percutio, deicio). </sense><sense id="n34686.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ventus Cercius plaustrum oneratum percellit, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 29</bibl>; cf.: vento perculsam ratem, Afran. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=273" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 273</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. p. 154 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> Rib.): magnas quercus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 194 Vahl.): abietem, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 152, 11</bibl>: alii adnutat ... alii percellit pedem, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 25</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 17 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">perii! perculit me prope,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicibus arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars communis saepe spoliantem jam et exsultantem evertit et perculit ab abjecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos Martis vis perculit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Marc. 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: Perii, plaustrum perculi! <hi rend="ital">I've upset my cart</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I've done for myself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34686.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetiali Postumius genu femur perculit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 11, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem cuspide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7, 32</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox repens perculit urbem,</quote> <trans><tr>struck</tr>, <tr>reached</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:91" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34686.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34686.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cast down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentiam perculisse atque afflixisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:8:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 8, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34686.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To strike with consternation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discourage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishearten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec te vox non perculit? non perturbavit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timore perculsi membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates atrocibus edictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:10:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos (timor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:651" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 651</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34686.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To urge on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres perculsae corda tuā vi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad turpitudinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 281</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perculit, in a neutr. signif., for perculsus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percenseo: <entryFree id="n34687" type="main" key="percense^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-censĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n34687.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to count over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enumerate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inveniendi locos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 36, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 36, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum legionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 26, 27, § 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34687.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34687.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to survey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">view;</hi> lit. and trop., <hi rend="ital">to review</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manipulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:50:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:648" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem acri subtilique ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34687.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">travel through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thessaliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
