percensio: <entryFree id="n34688" type="main" key="percensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>percenseo</etym>, <sense id="n34688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a survey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">review</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Orat. Ep. 3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Orat. Ep. 3</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
percepta: <entryFree id="n34689" type="main" key="percepta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percepta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, v. percipio, <sense id="n34689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perceptibilis: <entryFree id="n34690" type="main" key="percepti_^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perceptī^bĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> <etym>percipio</etym>. <sense id="n34690.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Perceptible</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 5, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34690.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Participating</hi><cb n="PERC" />  in any thing, Boëth. Dial. in Porphyr. 1, 20.</sense></entryFree>
perceptio: <entryFree id="n34691" type="main" key="percepti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perceptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>percipio</etym>, <sense id="n34691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receiving; a gathering in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collecting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34691.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum fruetuumque reliquorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34691.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">perception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehension</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">notio, cognitio): animi perceptiones,</quote> <trans><tr>notions</tr>, <tr>ideas</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: cognitio aut perceptio, aut si verbum e verbo volumus comprehensio, quam <foreign lang="greek">kata/lhyin</foreign> illi vocant, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perceptor: <entryFree id="n34692" type="main" key="perceptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perceptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a receiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imbiber</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Soliloq. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Soliloq. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
perceptus: <entryFree id="n34693" type="main" key="perceptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perceptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from percipio.</entryFree>
percernis: <entryFree id="n34694" type="gloss" key="percernis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percernis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>per-cerno</etym>, <sense id="n34694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily visible</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 615</bibl>, n. 127.</sense></entryFree>
percido: <entryFree id="n34695" type="main" key="perci_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cīdo</orth>, <itype>cīdi, cīsum</itype> (<sense id="n34695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> percecīdi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 7</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>caedo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to beat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cut to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smash.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34695.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">os alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34695.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n34695.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cut to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rout utterly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:20:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 20, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34695.4" n="B" level="2"> In mal. part., i. q. paedicare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:48:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 48, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:62:1 al" default="NO">7, 62, 1 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 5:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:35:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 35, 2</bibl>; cf.: percisus, paedicatus, <foreign lang="greek">pepugisme/nos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, alicui os, i. q. irrumare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:72:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 72, 3</bibl></cit> (al. praecisum).</sense></entryFree>
percieo: <entryFree id="n34696" type="main" key="perci^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cĭĕo</orth>, <itype>cīvi and ii, ĭtum, 2</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi and ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to move</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rouse greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34696.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">irai fax subdita percit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 303</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:184" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 184</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura hercle defringentur nisi istum verbum saepe unum perciet aureis Omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 563</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34696.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi> with words, <hi rend="ital">abuse</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">call aloud</hi> (by an opprobrious name): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem impudicum percies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 69</bibl></cit> Ussing ad loc.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">percĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">greatly moved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excited.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34696.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris causā percitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irā percitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrā bili percita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibili re atque atroci percitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo irato ac percito aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 23, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34696.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">excitable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium percitum ac ferox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:53:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 53, 8</bibl></cit>: corpore et linguā percitum, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 704</bibl> P. (Hist. 2, 35 Dietsch).</sense></entryFree>
percingo: <entryFree id="n34697" type="main" key="percingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percingo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. l. for praecingere (q. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:347" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 347</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 325</bibl>.</entryFree>
percio: <entryFree id="n34698" type="main" key="perci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. percieo.</entryFree>
percipibilis: <entryFree id="n34699" type="hapax" key="perci^pi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percĭpĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>percipio</etym>, <sense id="n34699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perceptible</hi>: aër ictus auditu percipibilis, Mar. Vict. p. 2451 P.</sense></entryFree>
percipio: <entryFree id="n34700" type="main" key="perci^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>cēpi, ceptum, 3</itype> (old form of the <sense id="n34700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> percepset for percepisset, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 26, 98</bibl>; v. Trag. Rel. p. 207 Rib.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>capio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to take wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to seize entirely</hi> (cf. occupo). </sense><sense id="n34700.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34700.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi horror misero membra percipit dictis tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam percipit (eum) insania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque urbis odium me umquam percipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae percipit humanos odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:605" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 605</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34700.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take to one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assume</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">varii sensus animantibus insunt, quorum quisque suam proprie rem percipit in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:985" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 985</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rigorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 745</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 5, 13, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucum thymi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:40" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34700.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serere, percipere, condere fructus,</quote> <trans><tr>to gather</tr>, <tr>collect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructum ex oleā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:5:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 141</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34700.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (so most freq. in class. lang.; syn.: sentio, intellego, comprehendo). </sense><sense id="n34700.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne, quod hic agimus, erus percipiat fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod neque oculis, neque auribus, neque ullo sensu percipi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebraeque nunc querelae, nunc minae percipiebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>were heard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae dicam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et aures, cum sonum percipere debeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 141</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">percipe auribus,</quote> <trans><tr>hear</tr>, <tr>give ear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 16, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n34700.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To feel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque majorem voluptatem ex infinito tempore aetatis percipi posse, quam ex hoc percipiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:60" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34700.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To learn</hi>, <pb n="1335" /> <cb n="PERC" /> <hi rend="ital">know</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">res percepta et cognita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percipere et comprehendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognosci et percipi posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificium aliquod,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem et humanitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 18, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium civium nomina perceperat,</quote> <trans><tr>knew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen Graecum, sed perceptum usu a nostris,</quote> <trans><tr>known</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:36:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 36, 91</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">perceptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">perceived</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observed.</hi>—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">percep-ta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">doctrines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rules</hi> of an art or science: percepta appello, quae dicuntur Graecis <foreign lang="greek">qewrh/mata</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 6, 11</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro percepto liquere,</quote> <trans><tr>as proved</tr>, <tr>certain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percis: <entryFree id="n34701" type="spur" key="percis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, a false reading for pegris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 150</bibl>.</entryFree>
percisus: <entryFree id="n34702" type="main" key="perci_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. percido.</entryFree>
percito: <entryFree id="n34703" type="main" key="perci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to excite thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemently</hi> (ante-class.), Pac. ap. Fest. s. v. reciprocare, p. 274 Müll.: matronae percitatae tumultu, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 467, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percitus: <entryFree id="n34704" type="main" key="perci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from percieo.</entryFree>
percivilis: <entryFree id="n34705" type="main" key="perci_vi_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cīvīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very courteous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">civil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perclamo: <entryFree id="n34706" type="spur" key="percla_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-clāmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, a false reading, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 8</bibl>; Speng. superba facta.</entryFree>
perclaresco: <entryFree id="n34707" type="main" key="percla_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-clāresco</orth>, <itype>clārŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n34707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become very clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very well known</hi> (postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:72" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 72</bibl> bis.</sense></entryFree>
percludo: <entryFree id="n34708" type="spur" key="perclu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perclūdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, a false reading for praecludo.</entryFree>
percnopterus: <entryFree id="n34709" type="greek" key="percnopte^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percnoptĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (= <foreign lang="greek">perkno/pteros</foreign>, dusky-winged), <sense id="n34709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain-stork</hi>, i. q. oripelargus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percnos: <entryFree id="n34710" type="greek" key="percnos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percnos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-nus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (= <foreign lang="greek">perkno/s</foreign>, dusky), <sense id="n34710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of eagle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percoctus: <entryFree id="n34711" type="main" key="percoctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percoctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from percoquo.</entryFree>
percoenare: <entryFree id="n34712" type="gloss" key="percoena_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-coenāre</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cen-</orth>), <foreign lang="greek">a)podeipnh=sai</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
percognitus: <entryFree id="n34713" type="main" key="percogni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percognĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from percognosco.</entryFree>
percognosco: <entryFree id="n34714" type="main" key="percognosco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cognosco</orth>, <itype>nōvi, nĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become perfectly acquainted with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit> (Speng. pergnovi).— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">percognĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">well known</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex naturae non ignota, etsi nondum percognita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 45, 45, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:45" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 3, 11, § 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percolapho: <entryFree id="n34715" type="main" key="perco^la^pho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cŏlăpho</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to buffet well</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
percolatio: <entryFree id="n34716" type="main" key="perco_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percōlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. percolo</etym>, <sense id="n34716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a straining through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a filtering</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percolo: <entryFree id="n34717" type="main" key="perco_lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cōlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strain through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to filter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">percolate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34717.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum vinum percolato, polentam abicito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:41:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 41, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 37, § 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34717.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to cause to pass through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor per terras percolatur,</quote> <trans><tr>passes through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 475</bibl></cit>: cibos et potiones, <hi rend="ital">to pass through one</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to swallow and digest</hi>, Sen. Q. N. praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: terra bibula crebros imbros percolat atque transmittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34718" type="main" key="perco^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cŏlo</orth>, <itype>cŏlŭi, cultum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n34718.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34718.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cultivate</hi>, of the soil; hence, <hi rend="ital">to inhabit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eleusiniam glebam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, 2, p. 257</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34718.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To perfect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incohata percolui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34718.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34718.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cleanse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">os curā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34718.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To deck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid eloquentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34718.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To honor greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to revere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si patrem percoles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugem liberosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos praefecturis et procurationibus, plerosque senatorii ordinis honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei numen in uxoris laboribus percolens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, 15, p. 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptii cerimoniis me propriis percolentes appellant Isidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>. 5, p. 259: <cit><quote lang="la">initia Cereris,</quote> <trans><tr>celebrate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 14:4" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:ib. 20:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34718.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To persecute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestras disciplinas studiosius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4, 18, p. 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumulata habent quae sedulo percolunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Deo Soc. 22, p. 54</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">percultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina perculta,</quote> <trans><tr>highly adorned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percolopo: <entryFree id="n34719" type="main" key="perco^lo^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percŏlŏpo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>per-colophus</etym>, <cb n="PERC" /> <sense id="n34719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to box the ears</hi> of one, <hi rend="ital">to beat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">larvas sic istos percolopabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percomis: <entryFree id="n34720" type="main" key="perco_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cōmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very friendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very courteous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:212" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 58, 212</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percommode: <entryFree id="n34721" type="main" key="percommo^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percommŏdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. percommodus.</entryFree>
percommodus: <entryFree id="n34722" type="main" key="percommo^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-commŏdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very convenient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very opportune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 43, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">percom-mŏdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very suitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very conveniently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">percommode accidit, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 27, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percommode factum est, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:30:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 30, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc percommode cadit quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perconor: <entryFree id="n34723" type="main" key="perco_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cōnor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n34723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry out</hi> an undertaking, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:46" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percontatio: <entryFree id="n34724" type="main" key="perconta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percontātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">percunct-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>percontor</etym>, <sense id="n34724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an asking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquiring</hi> after any thing; <hi rend="ital">a question</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquiry.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34724.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tempus percontatione consumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid percontationibus reperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percontatio quid in senatu esset actum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:218" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 60, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collocutio atque percontatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 30, 36, § 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34724.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., as a figure of speech, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 203</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percontative: <entryFree id="n34725" type="main" key="perconta_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percontātīvē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">percunct-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. percontativus <sense id="n34725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
percontativus: <entryFree id="n34726" type="main" key="perconta_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percontātīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">percunct-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>percontor</etym>, <sense id="n34726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">universally known</hi> (postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:8:114" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 8, 114</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34726.1" n="II" level="1"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">interrogative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 328</bibl></cit> P.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">percontātīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inquiringly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 161</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
percontator: <entryFree id="n34727" type="main" key="perconta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percontātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">percunct-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an asker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquirer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 31</bibl>: percontatorem fugito; <cit><quote lang="la">nam garrulus idem est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perconto: <entryFree id="n34728" type="main" key="perconto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perconto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">percuncto</orth>), <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (ante- and post-class.) [v. percontor], <sense id="n34728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to question strictly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">particularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inquire earnestly</hi>: docte percontat, Aeneas quo pacto, etc., Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 474, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si percontassem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:ib. 474:5" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> ib. 474, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sedulo percontaveram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 266, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34728.1" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">percontor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: de ovium dentibus opiliones percontantur, <hi rend="ital">are questioned</hi> (preceded by quae a grammatico quaerenda sunt), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:6:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">percontato pretio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">percontatum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ci/wma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a fundamental truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an established principle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:5:46" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 5, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percontor: <entryFree id="n34729" type="main" key="percontor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percontor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">percunct-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (<sense id="n34729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> percontarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:47 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 47 al.</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>per and root cunc-; Sanscr. canc- (canka, hesitation); cf. <foreign lang="greek">o)/knos</foreign> for <foreign lang="greek">ko/knos</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to ask particularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to question strictly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrogate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigate</hi> (class.; syn.: interrogo, sciscitor).—Constr.: <hi rend="ital">aliquem de aliquā re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> and <hi rend="ital">interrog.clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> alone; also, <hi rend="ital">aliquid ab</hi> (rarely <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>) <hi rend="ital">aliquo</hi> and <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">aliquem aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cocum percontabatur, possent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percontari hanc paucis hic volt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percontarier, utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me infit percontarier, ecquem noverim Demaenetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum percontor portitores, ecquae navis venerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percontare te perpetuisne malis voluptatibus perfruens ... degere aetatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 118</bibl></cit>: singulos percontari, cum quā sit aliqui deprensus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Porum percontatur an verum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spadonem ... num quid velit dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:11:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarem an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutricem, quid hoc rei sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu numquam mihi percontanti aut quaerenti aliquid defuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">percontando atque interrogando elicere alicujus opinionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percontari ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab adversariis percontabitur, quid, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 15, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eo percontaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum percontaretur ex aniculā quādam, quanti aliquid venderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:36:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 36, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his scribis percontamini quid velint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:79:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 79, § 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to ask a person respecting another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:9:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritos de ascensu Haemi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauca percunctatus de statu civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 12, 1</bibl>: quae percunctare eum magistratus<cb n="PERC" />  vellent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:49:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 49, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:11:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 11, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum si quis te percontabitur aevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34729.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To find out by inquiry</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. p. 113, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percontumax: <entryFree id="n34730" type="hapax" key="percontu^max"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-contŭmax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very obstinate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very contumacious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percooperio: <entryFree id="n34731" type="main" key="perco^o^pe^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cŏŏpĕrĭo</orth>, <itype>rŭi, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover entirely</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
percopiose: <entryFree id="n34732" type="main" key="perco_pi^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percōpĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. percopiosus <sense id="n34732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
percopiosus: <entryFree id="n34733" type="main" key="perco_pi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cōpĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, very abundantly supplied; <sense id="n34733.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">hence,</quote> <trans><tr>very rich in expression</tr>, <tr>very copious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 31, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">percōpĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very copiously</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
percoquo: <entryFree id="n34734" type="main" key="perco^quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cŏquo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to boil</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cook thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boil soft.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34734.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bubulas carnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 64, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lens non bene percocta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 70, § 142</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">In digitis hodie percoquam quod ceperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34734.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34734.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To heat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:858" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 858</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1254</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34734.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To ripen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mora percoquit uvas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol percoquit fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:31:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">messem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34734.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To scorch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blacken</hi> by the heat of the sun: <cit><quote lang="la">nigra virum percocto saecla colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 722</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percosius: <entryFree id="n34735" type="main" key="Perco_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Percōsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*perkw/sios</foreign>, <sense id="n34735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Percosius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Cyzicus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Percosia conjux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Clyte</tr>, <tr>wife of king Percosius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percote: <entryFree id="n34736" type="main" key="Perco_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Percōtē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*perkw/th</foreign>, <sense id="n34736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Trojan town on the coast of Mysia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bourgas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 40, § 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:622" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 622</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percrassus: <entryFree id="n34737" type="main" key="percrassus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-crassus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very thick</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percrebesco: <entryFree id="n34738" type="main" key="percre_besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-crēbesco</orth>, <itype>bŭi</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cre-bresco</orth>, <itype>brui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n34738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become very frequent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prevalent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be spread abroad</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoc percrebrescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (opinio) apud exteras nationes omnium sermone percrebruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4, 12</bibl>: res percrebuit; <cit><quote lang="la">in ore atque sermone omnium coepit esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:23:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 23, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum haec fama percrebuerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">68: fama percrebuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 43</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">94: quod cum percrebuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fama per orbem terrarum percrebuisset, illum a Caesare obsideri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:31" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugia percrebruisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percrepo: <entryFree id="n34739" type="main" key="percre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-crĕpo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n34739.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sound very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucum percrepare vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13, § 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34739.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to celebrate loudly</hi>: pugnam, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 255, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percresco: <entryFree id="n34740" type="main" key="percresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n34740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grow greatly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 36, 679</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percribro: <entryFree id="n34741" type="main" key="percri_bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-crībro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sift thoroughly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 87" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res contusae et percribratae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:ib. 289" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 289</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percrucio: <entryFree id="n34742" type="main" key="percru^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-crŭcĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to torment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vex greatly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc est demum quod percrucior,</quote> <trans><tr>for which I vex myself</tr>, <tr>grieve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percrudus: <entryFree id="n34743" type="main" key="percru_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-crūdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n34743.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">quite raw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34743.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">quite unripe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruna,</quote> <trans><tr>quite green</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percudo: <entryFree id="n34744" type="main" key="percu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cūdo</orth>, <itype>di, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">break through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an pulli rostellis ova percuderint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 14</bibl></cit> (Schneid. pertuderint).</sense></entryFree>
perculsus: <entryFree id="n34745" type="main" key="perculsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perculsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from percello.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34746" type="main" key="perculsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perculsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>percello</etym>, <sense id="n34746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shock</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percultor: <entryFree id="n34747" type="main" key="percultor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percultor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. percolo</etym>, <sense id="n34747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ardent adorer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reverencer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percultus: <entryFree id="n34748" type="main" key="percultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. percolo.</entryFree>
percumbo: <entryFree id="n34749" type="main" key="percumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cumbo</orth>, <itype>cŭbŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, mentioned as an unused form, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=49" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 49</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
percunctatio: <entryFree id="n34750" type="main" key="percuncta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percunctātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. percontatio.</entryFree>
percunctative: <entryFree id="n34751" type="main" key="percuncta_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percunctātīvē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">percunctātī-vus</orth>, v. percontativus.</entryFree>
percunctator: <entryFree id="n34752" type="main" key="percuncta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percunctātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, v. percontator.</entryFree>
percuncto: <entryFree id="n34753" type="main" key="percuncto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percuncto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">percunctor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. percontor.</entryFree>
percupidus: <entryFree id="n34754" type="main" key="percu^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cŭpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very partial to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very fond of</hi> one.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">percupidus tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percupio: <entryFree id="n34755" type="main" key="percu^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cŭpĭo</orth>, <itype>pĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wish greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire earnestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to long</hi> (ante-class.): percupio<pb n="1336" /> <cb n="PERC" />  obsequi gnato meo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percuriosus: <entryFree id="n34756" type="main" key="percu_ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cūrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very curious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inquisitive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servolus, percuriosus et minime mendax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 175</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percuro: <entryFree id="n34757" type="main" key="percu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to heal thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cure completely</hi> (perh. not anteAug.). </sense><sense id="n34757.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">percurato vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:23" default="NO">7, 6, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tarde percurabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec strumae percurentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 8, 28, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desperata a medicis vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34757.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem aegram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percurro: <entryFree id="n34758" type="main" key="percurro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-curro</orth>, <itype>percŭcurri or percurri, percursum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n34758.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to run through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasten through; to pass through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">along</hi> class.; syn. peragro). </sense><sense id="n34758.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">percurrere agrum Picenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labro calamos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 588</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapido percurrens turbine campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollice chordas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:46" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tenchteros et Cattos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aristas,</quote> <trans><tr>to speed over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percurrens luna fenestras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectine telas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 294</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignea rima micans percurrit lumine nimbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 392</bibl></cit>: tempora nodo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to wind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bind round</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:63" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 63</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 26, § 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortus fontano umore percurritur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34758.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to run through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimos honores percucurrit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>filled the highest offices one after another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesturam, praeturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 7</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">percursis honorum gradibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34758.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To run over in speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mention cursorily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes, quas modo percucurri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae breviter a te percursa sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 47, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multas res oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia poenarum nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celebres in eā arte quam maximā brevitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modice beneficia,</quote> <trans><tr>to mention in a cursory manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis, quae cujusque ductu gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:38:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 38, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:225" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 225</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34758.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To run over</hi> in the mind or with the eye, <hi rend="ital">to scan briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa animo et cogitatione, multa etiam legendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque id percurram brevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:32:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 32, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculo,</quote> <trans><tr>to run over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paginas in annalious magistratuum,</quote> <trans><tr>to run through</tr>, <tr>to look over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:600" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 600</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 328</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34758.5" n="4" level="3"> Of feelings, sensations, <hi rend="ital">to run through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium pectora occulto metu percurrente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 14</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34758.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to run</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run along</hi> to or over any thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">curriculo percurre (ad villam),</quote> <trans><tr>run thither quickly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: ad aliquem, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per temonem (currūs),</quote> <trans><tr>to run along the pole</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per mare et terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 668</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34758.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (very rare), <hi rend="ital">to pass;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">per</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to run over</hi> in speaking, <hi rend="ital">touch upon in succession</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam per omnis civitates quae decumas habent, percurrit oratio mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:42:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 42, § 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percursatio: <entryFree id="n34759" type="main" key="percursa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percursātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>percurso</etym>, <sense id="n34759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running</hi> or <hi rend="ital">travelling through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a traversing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 62</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:39:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 39, 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
percursio: <entryFree id="n34760" type="main" key="percursi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percursĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>percurro</etym>, <sense id="n34760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over;</hi> trop., </sense><sense id="n34760.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rapid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hasty thinking over</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">propter animi multarum rerum brevi tempore percursionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34760.2" n="II" level="1"> Rhet., <hi rend="ital">a rapid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hasty passing over</hi> a subject: <cit><quote lang="la">huic (commorationi) contraria saepe percursio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 202</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percurso: <entryFree id="n34761" type="main" key="percurso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percurso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n34761.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to run</hi> or <hi rend="ital">range through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ramble over</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ripas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:12:11" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 12, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34761.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to range</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rove about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">finibus nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:42:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 42, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percursor: <entryFree id="n34762" type="hapax" key="percursor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percursor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who runs through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 7</bibl></cit> dub. (al. praecursor).</sense></entryFree>
percursus: <entryFree id="n34763" type="main" key="percursus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percursus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from percurro.</entryFree>
percussibilis: <entryFree id="n34764" type="main" key="percussi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percussĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>percutio</etym>, <sense id="n34764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">penetrating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pervading</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">odor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:16:163" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 16, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 13, 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percussio: <entryFree id="n34765" type="main" key="percussi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percussĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">striking</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n34765.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis percussiones,</quote> <trans><tr>beatings on the head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a snapping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 19, 75</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PERC" /> —</sense><sense id="n34765.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in music and rhetoric, <hi rend="ital">a beating time;</hi> hence, concr., <hi rend="ital">time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">percussiones numerorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percussionum modi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:58:198" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 58, 198</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:108 al" default="NO">11, 3, 108 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
percussionalis: <entryFree id="n34766" type="main" key="percussi^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percussĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>percutio</etym>, <sense id="n34766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adapted for striking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">played by striking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumentum musicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Mus. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percussor: <entryFree id="n34767" type="main" key="percussor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percussor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stabber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shooter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34767.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">leo vulneratus percussorem novit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 19, § 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34767.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a murderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assassin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bandit</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: sicarius, interfector),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:6:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subornatus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:173" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percussura: <entryFree id="n34768" type="main" key="percussu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percussūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stroke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">percussura ferro facta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 14</bibl>. 54.</sense></entryFree>
percussus: <entryFree id="n34769" type="main" key="percussus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from percutio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34770" type="main" key="percussus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">percussus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>percutio</etym>, <sense id="n34770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">striking</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">caducis Percussu crebro saxa cavantur aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sentire percussum,</quote> <trans><tr>not to feel the injury deeply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:25:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra scorpionis percussum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 31, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
percutio: <entryFree id="n34771" type="main" key="percu^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-cŭtĭo</orth>, <itype>cussi, cussum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n34771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> contr. percusti for percussisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 273</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quatio</etym>. </sense><sense id="n34771.1" n="I" level="1"> (With the notion of the <hi rend="ital">per</hi> predominating.) <hi rend="ital">To strike through and through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thrust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pierce through</hi> (syn.: percello, transfigo). </sense><sense id="n34771.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">percussus cultello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:69:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 69, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladio percussus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 24, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mamilio pectus percussum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 19, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coxam Aeneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vena percutitur,</quote> <trans><tr>a vein is opened</tr>, <tr>blood is let</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossam,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut through</tr>, <tr>dig a trench</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 50, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34771.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to slay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kill</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neco, perimo, ico, ferio): aliquem securi,</quote> <trans><tr>to behead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 34, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum percussa securi Victima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem veneno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 252, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 94</bibl>.—Hence, percutere foedus, <hi rend="ital">to make a league</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclude a treaty</hi> (because an animal was slaughtered on the occasion; <cit><quote lang="la">only post-Aug. for ferio, ico), Auct. B.
