Alex. 44: cum Albanis foedus percussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:5:10" default="NO">43, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 5, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34771.4" n="II" level="1"> (With the idea of the verb predominating.) <hi rend="ital">To strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoot</hi>, etc. (cf.: ico, pulso, ferio). </sense><sense id="n34771.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34771.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ceu lapidem si Percutiat lapis aut ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Cato percussus esset ab eo, qui arcam ferebat,</quote> <trans><tr>had been struck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">januam manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:68" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:3" default="NO">1, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres de caelo percussae,</quote> <trans><tr>struck with lightning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc nec Juppiter fulmine percussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percussus ab aspide calcatā,</quote> <trans><tr>stung</tr>, <tr>bitten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 27, § 56</bibl></cit>; cf.: PERCVSSVS A VIPERA, Inscr. Vermigl. Iscriz. Perug. p. 319; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 3, 6, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:44" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 4, 10, § 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">color percussus luce refulgit,</quote> <trans><tr>struck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:799" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 799</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:495" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 495</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auriculae (voce) percussae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percussus vocibus circus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:398" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 398</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol percussit super caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jonae, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34771.7" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n34771.8" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stamp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coin</hi> money (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut nummum argenteum notā sideris Capricorni percusserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 25</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n34771.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">play</hi> a musical instrument (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">lyram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 12, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:100" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34771.10" n="c" level="4"> As t. t. in weaving, <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> the shuttle with the woof: (lacernae) male percussae textoris pectine Galli, <hi rend="ital">badly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coarsely woven</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:30" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34771.11" n="d" level="4"> Haec meraclo se percussit flore Libyco (=vino Mareotico), <hi rend="ital">to get drunk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 16</bibl> (cf.: sauciare se flore Liberi, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 562, 25</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n34771.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34771.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To smite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visit</hi> with calamity of any kind (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">percussus calamitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percussus fortunae vulnere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 14, 18</bibl></cit>: anathemate. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,047:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mal. 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Macc. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in stuporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Zach. 12, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34771.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make an impression upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affect deeply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astound</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">percussisti me de oratione prolatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 29, 79</bibl>: audivi ex Gavio, Romae esse hominem, et fuisse assiduum: percussit animum, <hi rend="ital">it struck me</hi>, <cb n="PERD" /> <hi rend="ital">made me suspicious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 8</bibl>, b, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">animos probabilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percussus atrocissimis litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragor aurem percutit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:98" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34771.15" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impose upon</hi> one (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem eruditum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem strategemate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem palpo,</quote> <trans><tr>to flatter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34771.16" n="4" level="3"> (Acc. to II. A. 2. a.) <hi rend="ital">To strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stamp</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">facta dictaque tua unā formā percussa sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 34:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 34, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdagatus: <entryFree id="n34772" type="hapax" key="perda_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdāgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> (from the obsol. perdāgo, like indago), <sense id="n34772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">explored</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
perdecipio: <entryFree id="n34773" type="main" key="perde_ci^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dēcĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>cēpi, ceptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deceive utterly</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">aurum populum ... sic specie perdecepit, ut hoc esse deum crederent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Chrys. Serm. 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdecorus: <entryFree id="n34774" type="main" key="perde^co_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dĕcōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very comely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very pretty</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perdefessus: <entryFree id="n34775" type="main" key="perde_fessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dēfessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worn out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utterly wearied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexationibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Chrys. Serm. 112</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdefleo: <entryFree id="n34776" type="main" key="perde_fle^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dēflĕo</orth>, ēre. <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis humani primordia perdeflenda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Chrys. Serm. 166</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdeleo: <entryFree id="n34777" type="main" key="perde_le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dēlĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to destroy utterly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exterminate</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perdelirus: <entryFree id="n34778" type="main" key="perde_li_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dēlīrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very silly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foolish</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 692</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perdensus: <entryFree id="n34779" type="main" key="perdensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-densus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very compact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very dense</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdeo: <entryFree id="n34780" type="main" key="perde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdĕo</orth> <itype>for pereo</itype>, v. pereo <sense id="n34780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perdepso: <entryFree id="n34781" type="hapax" key="perdepso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-depso</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to knead over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to work up</hi>, in mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:74:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 74, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perdicalis: <entryFree id="n34782" type="main" key="perdi_ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdīcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perdix</etym>, <sense id="n34782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to partridges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partridge-</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdiccas: <entryFree id="n34783" type="main" key="Perdiccas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Perdiccas</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Perdicca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*perdi/kkas</foreign>. <sense id="n34783.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Perdiccas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Macedonian general under Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:9:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:1" default="NO">4, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:19" default="NO">7, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:6" default="NO">13, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34783.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of three kings of Macedonia</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">Perdiccas III.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:5:6" default="NO">7, 5, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perdicium: <entryFree id="n34784" type="greek" key="perdi_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdīcĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">perdi/kion</foreign>. <sense id="n34784.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pellitory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">helxinen vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 17, 19, § 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34784.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The plant</hi> parthenium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 30, 104, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perdico: <entryFree id="n34785" type="main" key="perdi_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dīco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to say out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to finish saying</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 5, 607</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicit, perdicit, perdixit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdifficilis: <entryFree id="n34786" type="main" key="perdiffi^ci^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-diffĭcĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very difficult</hi> (class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 24, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdifficillimus aditus,</quote> <trans><tr>exceedingly difficult</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perdiffĭcĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with great difficulty</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perdifficiliter: <entryFree id="n34787" type="main" key="perdiffi^ci^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdiffĭcĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perdifficilis <sense id="n34787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perdignus: <entryFree id="n34788" type="main" key="perdignus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dignus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very worthy;</hi> with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo perdignus tuā amicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdiligens: <entryFree id="n34789" type="main" key="perdi_li^gens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dīlĭgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very diligent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perdīlĭgenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very diligently</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">complecti aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 3, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdisco: <entryFree id="n34790" type="main" key="perdisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-disco</orth>, <itype>dĭdĭci, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to learn thoroughly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get by heart</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia jura belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus de moribus est oratori perdiscendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis speciem pingere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad perdiscendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:36:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 36, 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:14:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 14, 2 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10</bibl> (9), 65.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdidici, isthaec esse vera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdisertus: <entryFree id="n34791" type="main" key="perdi^sertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dĭsertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very eloquent</hi> (late Lat. and rare), Gram. Vat. Praep. 5 (Class. Auct. vol. 5 Mai).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dĭsertē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">very eloquently</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 14, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perdite: <entryFree id="n34792" type="main" key="perdi^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdĭtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perdo, <sense id="n34792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perditim: <entryFree id="n34793" type="hapax" key="perdi^tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdĭtim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>perditus</etym>, <sense id="n34793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">desperately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to desperation</hi>: aliquam amare, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 191</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. v. 354 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
perditio: <entryFree id="n34794" type="main" key="perdi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perdo</etym>, <sense id="n34794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perdition</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perditionis iter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 4, 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 14, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 18, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 7, 13</bibl> et saep.; cf. perditio, <foreign lang="greek">a)pw/leia</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
perditor: <entryFree id="n34795" type="main" key="perdi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ruiner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroyer</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perditor rei publi cae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 36, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 3, 7</bibl>: vexa <pb n="1337" /> <cb n="PERD" /> tor et perditor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 34, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflictor et perditor ordinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 14, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perditrix: <entryFree id="n34796" type="main" key="perdi^trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdĭtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perditor</etym>, <sense id="n34796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that ruins</hi> or <hi rend="ital">destroys</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Cast. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 123</bibl>, n. 8.</sense></entryFree>
perditus: <entryFree id="n34797" type="main" key="perdi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from perdo.</entryFree>
perdiu: <entryFree id="n34798" type="main" key="perdi^u"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dĭu</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n34798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">for a great while</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very long</hi> (rare but class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:58" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdiu nihil eram auditurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 22, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perdius: <entryFree id="n34799" type="main" key="perdi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dies</etym>, <sense id="n34799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all day long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the livelong day</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">stare solitus Socrates dicitur, pertinaci statu perdius atque pernox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 161, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>, p. 219, 23.</sense></entryFree>
perdiuturnus: <entryFree id="n34800" type="main" key="perdi^u^turnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dĭŭturnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that lasts a very long time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very lingering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">protracted</hi> (rare but class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 85</bibl> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:27:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 27, 58</bibl> Halm and B. and K. read diuturnum).</sense></entryFree>
perdives: <entryFree id="n34801" type="main" key="perdi_ve^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dīvĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very rich</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier perdives et nobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdivisus: <entryFree id="n34802" type="main" key="perdi_vi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dīvīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wholly parted from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quite apart from</hi>: marito, Petr. Chrys. Serm, 164.</sense></entryFree>
perdix: <entryFree id="n34803" type="greek" key="perdix1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/rdic</foreign>, <sense id="n34803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a partridge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:37:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 37, 15</bibl>: perdicas Boeotios, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 218, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">picta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 17, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34804" type="main" key="Perdix2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Perdix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> In mythology, <sense id="n34804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the nephew of Dœdalus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:241 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 241 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 274" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 274</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perdo: <entryFree id="n34805" type="main" key="perdo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-do</orth>, <itype>dĭdi, ditum, 3</itype> (old form of the <sense id="n34805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi> perduim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perduis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 215</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perduit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 29</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but esp. freq., perduint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 4, 3</bibl>.—As the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> of perdo, only pereo, perditus, perire appear to be in good use.—The only classical example of <hi rend="ital">a pass.</hi> form in the <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> is: <cit><quote lang="la">perditur haec inter misero lux non sine votis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 59</bibl></cit> (K. and H. ad loc.), where Lachm., perh. needlessly, reads lux porgitur, <hi rend="ital">the day seems too long for me.</hi>—In the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> perdi, in late Lat.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to make away with; to destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin; to squander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissipate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lose</hi>, etc. (class.; syn.: dissipo, perimo, deleo). </sense><sense id="n34805.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem perditum ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter fruges perdidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:45:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 45, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funditus civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipsum penitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdere et affligere cives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdere et pessundare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem capitis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to charge with a capital offence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumat, consumat, perdat,</quote> <trans><tr>squander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 56</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">perde et peri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdere et profundere,</quote> <trans><tr>to waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdere tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:36:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 36, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 10, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum et operam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Decius amisit vitam: at non perdidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 44, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur perdis adulescentem nobis? cur amat? Cur potat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—In execrations (very common): di (deaeque omnes) te perduint, <hi rend="ital">may the gods destroy you!</hi> See the passages with perduint cited <hi rend="ital">init.—Pass.</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">verbis perderis ipse tuis, Prosp. Epigr.: impii de terrā perdentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: quasi sterquilinium in fine perdetur, id. Job, 20, 7.—</sense><sense id="n34805.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to lose utterly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">irrecoverably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos (liberos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes fructus industriae et fortunae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litem,</quote> <trans><tr>to lose one's cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:36:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 36, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextram manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 13:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perii hercle! nomen perdidi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I have quite forgotten the name</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 39</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">si principis vita perditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 59</bibl> (v. supra).—Of loss at play: <cit><quote lang="la">ne perdiderit, non cessat perdere lusor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 451</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:93" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 93</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">perdĭtus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <cb n="PERD" /> <itype>um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">lost</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n34805.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Hopeless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desperate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">past recovery</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. profligatus): perditus sum, i. q. perii,</quote> <trans><tr>I am lost!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per fortunas vide, ne puerum perditum perdamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perditus aere alieno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis ac maerore perditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 40, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu omnium mortalium perditissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:26:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 26, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus omnibus perditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:31:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 31, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatoria judicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:10:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 10, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34805.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">desperately in love; lost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruined</hi> by love (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">amore haec perdita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in puellā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:89:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 89, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34805.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lost</hi> in a moral sense, <hi rend="ital">abandoned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profligate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flagitious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorrigible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens perditus ac dissolutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:25:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 25, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo contaminatus, perditus, flagitiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:58:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 58, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abjecti homines et perditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:18:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 18, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo perditā nequitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdita atque dissoluta consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 20, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriae ac lasciviae perditae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil fieri potest miserius, nihil perditius, nihil foedius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:42:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 42, 13</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium mortalium perditissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:5:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 5, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perdĭtē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n34805.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In an abandoned manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorrigibly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl></cit>, A, 2.—</sense><sense id="n34805.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Desperately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdoceo: <entryFree id="n34806" type="main" key="perdo^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dŏcĕo</orth>, <itype>cui, ctum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to teach</hi> or <hi rend="ital">instruct thoroughly</hi> (rare but class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. erudio): res difficilis ad perdocendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:44:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 44, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanti istuc unum me coquitare perdoces?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid Apollo Utile mortales perdocet ore meo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam stultitiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to betray</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignam Maeoniis Phaeacida condere chartis Cum te Pierides perdocuere tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 12, 28</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">perdoctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">very learned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very skilful</hi> (rare but class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:27:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 27, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 473</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perdoctē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very skilfully</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perdoleo: <entryFree id="n34807" type="main" key="perdo^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dŏlĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype>, ìtum, <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n34807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grieve greatly</hi> (ante-class.): id perdolitum est T. Manlio, Q. Claud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem perdoluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdolesco: <entryFree id="n34808" type="main" key="perdo^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdŏlesco</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-dŏlisco</orth>, <itype>lŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n34808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [per-doleo], <hi rend="ital">to feel great pain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grief</hi>: nec perdoliscit fligi socios, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 110, 31</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 150 Rib.): suam virtutem irrisui fore perdoluerunt, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perdolo: <entryFree id="n34809" type="main" key="perdo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hew out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fashion with hewing</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum in materiem perdolantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor perdolata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fomes perdolatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 209</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdominor: <entryFree id="n34810" type="hapax" key="perdo^mi^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dŏmĭnor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n34810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rule</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reign throughout</hi> a period of time: <cit><quote lang="la">annum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Fesc. Nupt. Honor. 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdomitor: <entryFree id="n34811" type="main" key="perdo^mi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdŏmĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perdomo</etym>, <sense id="n34811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tamer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subduer</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdomitus: <entryFree id="n34812" type="main" key="perdo^mi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdŏmĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perdomo.</entryFree>
perdomo: <entryFree id="n34813" type="main" key="perdo^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dŏmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n34813.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To tame</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subdue thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to subjugate completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to conquer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanquish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>, etc. (Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. subigo): ad perdomandum Latium exercitum circumducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apulia perdomita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:95:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 95, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:3:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes, tauros feroces,</quote> <trans><tr>to tame</tr>, <tr>subdue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 163</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 447</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34813.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to work thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to knead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">farinam assiduā tractatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: perdomitam saxo Cererem, <hi rend="ital">prepared</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">ground</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:524" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 524</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34813.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nono demum sulco (solum) perdometur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdormisco: <entryFree id="n34814" type="hapax" key="perdormisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dormisco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>dormio</etym>, <sense id="n34814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sleep on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdormiscin' tu usque ad lucem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perduco: <entryFree id="n34815" type="main" key="perdu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n34815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imper.</hi> perduce for perduc, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 40, 754</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, lit., <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring through;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n34815.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guide</hi> a person or thing <cb n="PERD" /> to any place. </sense><sense id="n34815.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">filium illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprehensos eos ad Caesarem perduxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem in Allobrogas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyrum ad angustias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nautas ad aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Sullam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in theatrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in conspectum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bovem errantem ad stabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauros ad sacrificium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34815.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n34815.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To draw over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring over</hi> a woman to the acceptance of a lover: <cit><quote lang="la">huc Tertia perducta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 12, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34815.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi> to a place; <cit><quote lang="la">of buildings, ditches, water (esp. freq. in Front.): a lacu Lemano ad montem Juram murum perducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitiones ex castellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longum opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appia (aqua) perducta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum duumviri aquae perducendae creati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib. 6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas in urbem perducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib. 7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Anionem in Capitolium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib. 7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem in agro Lucullano collectam Romam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib. 10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">13 et saep.: navigabilem alveum ex portu in Nilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 33, § 165</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34815.6" n="3" level="3"> Of money, <hi rend="ital">to deliver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 80:2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 80, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34815.7" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34815.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To spread over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedaub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besmear</hi> with any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus odore ambrosiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 415</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:55" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus stercore gallinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 39, 739</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus succo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 49, 922</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crusta perducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 237" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 237</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34815.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To rub out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erase</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si aliquid interleverit, perduxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen in testamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:11:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 37, 11, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4:11" default="NO">28, 4, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34815.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take a drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drink off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to quaff</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cyceonis liquorem, Arn. poët. 5, 175: poculum continuo haustu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, 5, p. 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aloë ex aquae cyathis tribus frigidis perducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 135" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 135 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n34815.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34815.12" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guide</hi> a person or thing to a certain goal, to a certain period, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">res disputatione ad mediam noctem perducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnatio ad noctem perducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in noctem orationibus perductis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tempus tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se medicinā usque ad longam senectam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex humili loco ad summam dignitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 39</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad amplissimos honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(agri colendi studia) ad centesimum annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 17, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem ad magnam gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 36, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad perniciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ad effectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ad exitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:56:169" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 56, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ad finem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo rem perduxit,</quote> <trans><tr>brought the matter to that pass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ad liquidum confessumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34815.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:39" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34815.14" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">win over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to persuade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">induce</hi> (to an opinion or an action, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): si dictis nequis perduci, ut vera haec credas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perducebam illam ad me suadelā meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad suam sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: aliquem in suam sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad se magnis pollicitationibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring over to one's side</tr>, <tr>to gain over</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem ad HS LXXX.,</quote> <trans><tr>to induce to pay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perductio: <entryFree id="n34816" type="main" key="perducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perduco, I. A. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n34816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conducting</hi> of water (only in Vitr.): <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum perductiones ad habitationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perducto: <entryFree id="n34817" type="main" key="perducto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perducto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>perduco</etym>, <sense id="n34817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi> to or over a place (Plautin. in the double sense of perductor, q. v.): <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid est, errabo potius, quam perductet quispiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 160</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perductor: <entryFree id="n34818" type="main" key="perductor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perductor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conductor;</hi> in partic., <hi rend="ital">a pimp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pander</hi> (cf. perduco, I. B. 1.): <cit><quote lang="la">lenonum, aleatorum, perductorum nulla mentio fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12, § 34</bibl></cit> (lenones sunt scortorum: perductores etiam invitarum personarum, et in quibus stupra exercita legibus vindicantur, Ascon. ad h. l.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 17, 19</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n34818.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A guide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conductor</hi>, in a double sense with the <pb n="1338" /> <cb n="PERE" /> preced. signif.: <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Eho istum, puer, circumduce hasce aedes et conclavia. <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Apage istum a me perductorem: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil moror ductarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:159 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 159 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
perductus: <entryFree id="n34819" type="main" key="perductus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perduco.</entryFree>
perdudum: <entryFree id="n34820" type="hapax" key="perdu_dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dūdum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n34820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very long time ago</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi edepol hominem haut perdudum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perduellio: <entryFree id="n34821" type="main" key="perdu^elli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdŭellĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perduellis</etym>. <sense id="n34821.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hostile conduct against one's country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treason</hi>, whether consisting of an attempt against the state, its institutions, and chief ruler, or of union with a foreign enemy, desertion, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui perduellionis reus est, hostili animo adversus rempublicam vel principem animatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:4:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Clodius) actionem perduellionis intenderat (for causing the execution of the Catilinarians who were Roman citizens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perduellionis judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: tum Sempronius, perduellionis se judicare Cn. Fulvio dixit, <hi rend="ital">that he accused Fulvius of high-treason</hi> (for allowing himself to be defeated), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duumviros, qui Horatio perduellionem judicent, secundum legem facio (for killing his sister, which was regarded as a usurpation of the prerogative of punishment, and hence as a crime against the state),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem perduellionis alicui dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 5, 3</bibl>.—*</sense><sense id="n34821.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">a</hi> (<hi rend="ital">foreign</hi>) <hi rend="ital">enemy of one's country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a public enemy;</hi> for the usual hostis (censured as a bombastic expression), <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 16, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perduellis: <entryFree id="n34822" type="main" key="perdu^ellis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dŭellis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n34822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> perduellūm, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 22, 15</bibl>, or Trag. Rel. p. 238 Rib.; <case>abl.</case> perdvellibus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=49" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 49</bibl> Müll., or p. 146 Vahl.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>per-duellum, i. e. bellum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a public enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an enemy</hi> actually waging war against a country (mostly anteclass. for the class. hostis): <cit><quote lang="la">quos nos hostes appellamus, eos veteres perduelles appellabant, per eam adjectionem indicantes, cum quibus bellum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:234" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem illud etiam animadverto, quod qui proprio nomine perduellis esset, is hostis vocaretur, lenitate verbi tristitiam rei mitigante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 3</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Ennium perduelles dicuntur hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=49" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 49</bibl></cit> ib.: perduelles superati, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 16, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pirata non est ex perduellium numero, sed communis hostis omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">29, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34822.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a private enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an enemy</hi>, = inimicus (Plautin.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15</bibl>.— Perduellis seems never to mean traitor to one's country (cf. perduellio); in this sense parricida is used instead.</sense></entryFree>
perduellum: <entryFree id="n34823" type="main" key="perdu^ellu^m"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdŭellŭm</orth>, v. perduellis <sense id="n34823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perduis: <entryFree id="n34824" type="main" key="perdu^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perdŭis</orth>, <itype>it</itype>, etc., v. perdo <sense id="n34824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perdulcis: <entryFree id="n34825" type="gloss" key="perdulcis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dulcis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very sweet; sup.</hi> ‡ PERDVLCISSIMUS, Inscr. Rein. cl. 20, n. 150.</sense></entryFree>
perduro: <entryFree id="n34826" type="main" key="perdu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n34826.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to harden</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">teneras plantas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 447</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34826.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to last</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hold out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to endure</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">obduro, perfero),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdurare non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdurandi pervicacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 34, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longum probitas perdurat in aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mora perduratura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:142" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non perdurasse in senectutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotidie unanimiter in templo,</quote> <trans><tr>abide</tr>, <tr>continue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 2, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perdurus: <entryFree id="n34827" type="main" key="perdu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-dūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very hard</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">interpretatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:3:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peredia: <entryFree id="n34828" type="main" key="Pere^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Perĕdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>peredo</etym>, <sense id="n34828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Gobbledom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Eating-land</hi>, a comically formed name of a country, analogous to Bibesia,. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peredo: <entryFree id="n34829" type="main" key="pe^re^do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ĕdo</orth>, <itype>ēdi, ēsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to eat up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n34829.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: cibum, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 893</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque panes et gemellos pisces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34829.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devour</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec peredit Impositam celer ignis Aetnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 75</bibl></cit>: lacrimae peredere umore exsangues genas, old poet in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 225 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">vesco sale saxa peresa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit> (18): <cit><quote lang="la">morbo peresa Vellera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 561</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34829.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waste away</hi>, etc.: <cb n="PERE" /> quos durus amor crudeli tabe peredit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 442</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">languoribus peresus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34830" type="hapax" key="pe^re_do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ēdo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give forth</hi>, an old poet in <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perefflo: <entryFree id="n34831" type="main" key="perefflo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-efflo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to breathe out entirely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breathe away</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 207, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pereffluo: <entryFree id="n34832" type="hapax" key="perefflu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-efflŭo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n34832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flow through.</hi>— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to forget</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 2, 1</bibl> (transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pararruw=men</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
pereger: <entryFree id="n34833" type="main" key="pe^re^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕger</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-gris</orth>), <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>per-ager, who has gone through lands, i. e.</etym>, <sense id="n34833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">who is on a journey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">away from home</hi> (postclass.): si pereger factus sit, Ulp. Reg. tit. 17, 1 (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Huschke, peregrinus): nedum me peregrem composita fabulari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 17</bibl></cit>: susceptor peregrum, Ven. Carm. 4, 10, 14.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms, peregre and (ante- and post-class.) peregri, <hi rend="ital">abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">away from home.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34833.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕgrē</orth>, answering to the question where? whence? or whither? </sense><sense id="n34833.2" n="1" level="3"> To the question where? qui peregre depugnavit, <hi rend="ital">abroad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum peregre est animus sine corpore velox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectacula dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 20, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34833.3" n="2" level="3"> To the question whence?
