<hi rend="ital">from abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from foreign parts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom peregre veniet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolā peregre allatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregre redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in regnum Romam accitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:6:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 6, 29</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a peregre,</quote> <trans><tr>from abroad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34833.4" n="3" level="3"> To the question whither? <hi rend="ital">abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to foreign parts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam peregre hinc ejus pater abiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregre abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 43, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusve peregreve exire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:196" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 25, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34833.5" n="4" level="3"> Like peregri (v. infra), <hi rend="ital">abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not at home</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 30</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n34833.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕgrī</orth>, <hi rend="ital">abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">away from home</hi>, to the question where? (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">peregrique et domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. domi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 196</bibl></cit>: patriam ut colatis potius quam peregri probra, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 189</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. p. 19 Rib.): peregri necandus, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 4, 89.</sense></entryFree>
peregre: <entryFree id="n34834" type="main" key="pe^re^gre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕgrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pereger <sense id="n34834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
peregregius: <entryFree id="n34835" type="main" key="pe^re_gre^gi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ēgrĕgĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very excellent</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tragoedia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 298, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peregri: <entryFree id="n34836" type="main" key="pe^re^gri_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕgrī</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pereger <sense id="n34836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
peregrinabundus: <entryFree id="n34837" type="main" key="pe^re^gri_na_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕgrīnābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>peregrinor</etym>, <sense id="n34837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">travelling about</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 18, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
peregrinat: <entryFree id="n34838" type="gloss" key="pere^gri_nat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perĕgrīnat</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">ceniteu/ei</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</entryFree>
peregrinatio: <entryFree id="n34839" type="main" key="pe^re^gri_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕgrīnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>peregrinor</etym>, <sense id="n34839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being</hi> or <hi rend="ital">living abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sojourning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a travelling in foreign parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a travelling about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">travel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peregrination</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n34839.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transmarina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:18" default="NO">12, 11, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra peregrinationis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus in peregrinatione consumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 103</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34839.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae peregrinatione laetantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:33:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 33, 109</bibl></cit>.—Of muscles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peregrinator: <entryFree id="n34840" type="hapax" key="pe^re^gri_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕgrīnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who travels about</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peregrinitas: <entryFree id="n34841" type="main" key="pe^re^gri_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕgrīnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>peregrinus</etym>. <sense id="n34841.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The condition of a</hi> peregrinus or <hi rend="ital">foreigner</hi>, opp. to that of a Roman citizen, <hi rend="ital">alienage</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinitatis reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in peregrinitatem redigere aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 4, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34841.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34841.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">outlandish ways</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreign habits</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manners</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum in urbem nostram infusa est peregrinitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34841.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a foreign tone</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accent</hi> in speaking (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">os, in quo nulla peregrinitas resonet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peregrinor: <entryFree id="n34842" type="main" key="pe^re^gri_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕgrīnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n34842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">live in foreign parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sojourn abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to travel about</hi> (class.; cf.: peragro, migro). </sense><sense id="n34842.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinari totā Asiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 13, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alienā civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 47, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34842.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34842.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to travel about; to roam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rove</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">wander about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec studia pernoctant nobiscum, peregrinantur, rusticantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: animus <cb n="PERE" /> late longeque peregrinatur, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D 1, 20, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in infinitatem omnem,</quote> <trans><tr>to roam through all infinity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34842.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be a stranger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sojourner</hi> (cf. peregrinus, B.): <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiae quasi civitatem dare, quae quidem adhuc peregrinari Romae videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:12:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrae peregrinantur aures?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 12, 33</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be absent from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stranger to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a corpore, a Dei regno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 12, § 17; id. de Isaac et An. 5, 17; so, <cit><quote lang="la">a Domino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peregrinulus: <entryFree id="n34843" type="main" key="pe^re^gri_nu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕgrīnŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>peregrinus</etym>, <sense id="n34843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">estranged</hi> (late Lat.), Ven. Fort. Vit. Germ. 64.</sense></entryFree>
peregrinus: <entryFree id="n34844" type="main" key="pe^re^gri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕgrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>peregre</etym>, <sense id="n34844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that comes from foreign parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exotic</hi> (cf.: exter, externus). </sense><sense id="n34844.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34844.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n34844.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad portum mittunt servulos, ancillulas: peregrina navis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:836" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 836</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 13, 12, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 17, 29, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 10, 64, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eluamus hodie peregrina omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 19</bibl></cit> (668 Ritschl): <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of travelling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 31, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <trans><tr>for foreign women</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasti,</quote> <trans><tr>of foreign nations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:298" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terror,</quote> <trans><tr>of a foreign enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut peregrinum otium alicui permittere,</quote> <trans><tr>almost the leisure of a stranger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrina sacra appellantur, quae coluntur eorum more, a quibus sunt accepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=237" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 237</bibl></cit> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n34844.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕgrīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a foreigner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stranger</hi> (very freq. and class.; syn.: hospes, advena, alienigena; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. civis): peregrinus ego sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrini atque advenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrini et incolae officium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrini reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in nostrā patriā peregrini atque advenae esse videamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 249</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34844.5" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕgrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a foreign woman</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34844.6" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, in partic., opp. to a Roman citizen, <hi rend="ital">a foreign resident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an alien</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque civem, neque peregrinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 77</bibl></cit>: peregrinus fit is, cui aquā et igni interdictum est, Regul. tit. 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 5, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n34844.7" n="2" level="3"> As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor,</quote> <trans><tr>who decided causes between foreign residents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:16" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinus ager est, qui neque Romanus, neque hosticus habetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=245" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 245</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum sunt genera quinque, Romanus, Gabinus, peregrinus, hosticus, incertus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=33" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 33</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrini milites,</quote> <trans><tr>Roman troops who were not Roman citizens</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3467 sq.</bibl></cit>; their quarters in Rome were called, after them, CASTRA PEREGRINA, and were situated in the second region, by the modern <hi rend="ital">S. Stefano Rotondo</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Marin. Atti dei Frat. Arv. p. 434 sq.: provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34844.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexperienced</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nullā in re tironem ac rudem, nec peregrinum atque hospitem in agendo esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 218</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perelegans: <entryFree id="n34845" type="main" key="pe^re_le^gans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ēlĕgans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very neat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">elegant</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 24, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ēlĕganter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very finely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very elegantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pereleganter dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:52:197" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 52, 197</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perelixo: <entryFree id="n34846" type="main" key="pe^re_lixo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ēlixo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to boil thoroughly</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">denuo eum perelixabis (al. perlaxabis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:7:section=289" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 7, § 289</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pereloquens: <entryFree id="n34847" type="main" key="pe^re_lo^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ēlŏquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very eloquent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lentulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:70:247" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 70, 247</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peremensus: <entryFree id="n34848" type="gloss" key="pe^re_mensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ēmensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all measured out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">permensus, peremensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peremne: <entryFree id="n34849" type="main" key="pe^remne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕremne</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. peremnis.</entryFree>
peremnis: <entryFree id="n34850" type="main" key="pe^remnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕremnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>per-amnis</etym>, <sense id="n34850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to crossing a river;</hi> only in augural lang., peremne auspicium, and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕremne</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the auspices taken by magistrates on crossing a river or a spring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peremne dicitur auspicari, qui amnem aut aquam, quae ex sacro oritur, auspicato transit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=245" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 245</bibl></cit> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">p. 250 Müll.: bella nullis auspiciis administrantur: nulla peremnia servantur, nulla ex acuminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:36:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 36, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peremo: <entryFree id="n34851" type="main" key="pe^re^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĕmo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. perimo. <pb n="1339" /> <cb n="PERE" /></entryFree>
peremptalis: <entryFree id="n34852" type="main" key="pe^rempta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕremptālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>peremptus</etym>, <sense id="n34852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to destruction</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abolition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abolishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cancelling;</hi> only in augural lang., fulmina, <hi rend="ital">lightnings that destroy the effect</hi> or <hi rend="ital">portent of former lightnings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peremptalia fulgura Gracchus ait vocari, quae superiora fulgura aut portenta vi suā perimant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=214" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 214</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">peremptalia fulmina, quibus tolluntur priorum fulminum minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:49:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 49, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peremptio: <entryFree id="n34853" type="main" key="pe^rempti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕremptĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pĕremtĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perimo</etym>, <sense id="n34853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a destroying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">killing</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Joann. 27" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Joann. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
peremptor: <entryFree id="n34854" type="main" key="pe^remptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕremptor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pĕremtor</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a destroyer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderer</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">incluti regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 221" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mariti mei cruentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 207, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">puer ille peremptor meus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who has playued me almost to death</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 198, 21.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, Prud. Ham. praef. 19; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Inst. Virg. 7, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 4, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peremptorie: <entryFree id="n34855" type="main" key="pe^rempto_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕremptōrĭē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pĕremtōr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. peremptorius <sense id="n34855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
peremptorius: <entryFree id="n34856" type="main" key="pe^rempto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕremptōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pĕremtōr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n34856.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">destructive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deadly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortal</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 243, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34856.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, qs. that destroys or precludes all debate, i. e. <hi rend="ital">decisive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">final</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peremptory</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">peremptorium edictum inde hoc nomen sumpsit, quod perimeret disceptationem, hoc est ultra non pateretur adversarium tergiversari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:70" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicuntur exceptiones aut peremptoriae aut dilatoriae. Peremptoriae sunt, quae perpetuo valent nec evitari possunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:section=120 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, § 120 sq.</bibl></cit> and 121; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 1, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕremptōrĭē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pĕremtōr-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">in a peremptory manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peremptorily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peremptrix: <entryFree id="n34857" type="main" key="pe^remptrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕremptrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pĕremtr-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>peremptor</etym>, <sense id="n34857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that destroys</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kills</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mors peremptrix sensūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peremptus: <entryFree id="n34858" type="main" key="pe^remptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕremptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pĕremtus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perimo.</entryFree>
perendie: <entryFree id="n34859" type="main" key="pe^rendi^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrendĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pe/ran</foreign>-dies</etym>, <sense id="n34859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on the day after to-morrow</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cras agito, perendie agito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scies igitur fortasse cras, summum perendie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 44, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 17, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perendinatio: <entryFree id="n34860" type="main" key="pe^rendi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrendĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perendinus</etym>, <sense id="n34860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting off till the day after to-morrow</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 897</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perendinus: <entryFree id="n34861" type="main" key="pe^rendi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrendĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perendie</etym>, <sense id="n34861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">after to-morrow</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tot homines tam ingeniosos, per tot annos statuere non potuisse, utrum diem tertium, an perendinum dici oporteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perendino die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tu in perendinum paratus sis,</quote> <trans><tr>against the day after to-morrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies perendini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perenna: <entryFree id="n34862" type="main" key="Pe^renna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrenna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Anna.</entryFree>
perenne: <entryFree id="n34863" type="main" key="pe^renne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrennē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perennis <sense id="n34863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perennis: <entryFree id="n34864" type="main" key="pe^rennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrennis</orth> (‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕremnis</orth>, Inscr. Ann. p. Chr. 341 ap. Guattani Monum. Inedit. 1, 5, p. 39), e (<sense id="n34864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> perenne, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:654" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 654</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>per-annus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">that lasts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">continues the year through</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aves perennes,</quote> <trans><tr>that remain with us all the year round</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 25, 36, § 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34864.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">everlasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">never failing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unceasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perennial</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jugis, perpetuus): aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 8, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus stellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that bears keeping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adamas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:813" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 813</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:265" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 265</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">of a person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">super Astra ferar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:875" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 875</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exegi monumentum aere perennius,</quote> <trans><tr>more lasting</tr>, <tr>more enduring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34864.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unfailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninterrupted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetual</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">lucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:page=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. p. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perennis et contestata majorum virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuata motio et perennis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquacitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus in rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 9, 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms, pĕrenne (post-Aug.) and pĕrennĭter (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n34864.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrenne</orth>. </sense><sense id="n34864.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">all the year through</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n34864.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">constantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetually</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">abies perenne durabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 15</bibl></cit>, <cb n="PERE" /> 1: <cit><quote lang="la">perenne vivax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 11, 68</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34864.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrennĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">constantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">always</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetually</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor frondens perenniter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Christ. 2:16" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Christ. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perenniter servare amicitias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 7, 20, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perenniservus: <entryFree id="n34865" type="hapax" key="pe^renni^servus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrennĭ-servus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perennis</etym>, <sense id="n34865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who is always a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perennitas: <entryFree id="n34866" type="main" key="pe^renni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrennĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lastingness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continuance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetual duration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetuity</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fontium perennitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <trans><tr>constant food</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perennitatem conditis frumentis afferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 13, 22: Perennitas, <hi rend="ital">a title of the Roman emperors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestra,</quote> <trans><tr>your perpetuity</tr>, <tr>your perennity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:45" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 45</bibl></cit>; Sex. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Brev. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perenno: <entryFree id="n34867" type="main" key="pe^renno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrenno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n34867.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">preserve long</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ea res, etiamsi non in totum perennat, certe usque in alteram vindemiam plerumque vini saporem servat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 8</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. perennem); 12, 19, 2.—</sense><sense id="n34867.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to last for many years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">arte perennat amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut diutius perennent boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:18" default="NO">2, 9, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:721" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 721</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens ultra aevi nostri terminos perennans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perenticida: <entryFree id="n34868" type="hapax" key="pe^renti^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrentĭcīda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for pericida [pera-caedo], <sense id="n34868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutpurse</hi> (a word comically formed with allusion to parenticida), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pereo: <entryFree id="n34869" type="main" key="pe^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ĕo</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype> (īvi), ĭtum, īre (periet for peribit, Coripp. Johann. 7, 27; <sense id="n34869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> perivit, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perīt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:85" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 20, 17 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 49, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:19:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 19, 56</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> periet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:4:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 4, 19 al.</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> </sense><sense id="n34869.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come to nothing; to vanish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be lost</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecqua inde perisset soror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vena periret aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34869.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to pass through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be absorbed</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">lymphae Dolium pereuntis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">postremo pereunt imbres, ubi eos pater aether In gremium matris terrai praecipitavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 250</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34869.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be destroyed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to perish</hi> (the predom. and class. signif. of the word; syn.: occĭdo, intereo, obeo). </sense><sense id="n34869.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes cum fundamento perierint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam pecuniam tam brevi tempore perire potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum exercitum periturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac pereat vitreo miles ab hoste tuus (in the game of chess),</quote> <trans><tr>let your knight be taken by a pawn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae cur urbes perirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritura regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:600" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Troja peritura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pereunt sole tepente nives,</quote> <trans><tr>melt away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:236" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum rubigine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabae laeso flore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:267" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 267</bibl></cit>.—Of the crocus: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudet calcari et atteri, pereundoque melius provenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34869.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n34869.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To perish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lose one's life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">die</hi> (class.): non intellego, quamobrem, si vivere honeste non possunt, perire turpiter velint; <cit><quote lang="la">aut cur minore dolore perituros se cum multis, quam si soli pereant, arbitrentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo cruciatu supplicioque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:57:172" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 57, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem leto esse pereundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:26:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 26, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naufragio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque juravit, periturum inter nos secretum,</quote> <trans><tr>that it should perish with us</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Hannibale,</quote> <trans><tr>at his hands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 73, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perire turpiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 37, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34869.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pine away with love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be desperately in love; to love to desperation</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">indigno cum Gallus amore peribat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 45, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo beatus Vulnere, quā pereat sagittā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse Paris nudā fertur periisse Lacaenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:12:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 12, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> of the beloved object, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34869.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be lost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wasted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spent in vain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne et oleum et opera perierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus perit otio dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 6, 5, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne nummi pereant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:29" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">actiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34869.9" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be lost</hi>, <cb n="PERF" /> <hi rend="ital">ruined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fieri tum potuit? jampridem perieramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo vitio pereo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, perii, etc., as an exclamation of despair, <hi rend="ital">I am lost! I'm undone!</hi> hei mihi, disperii! vocis non habeo satis: <cit><quote lang="la">vicini, interii, perii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perii, interii, occidi! quo curram! quo non curram?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perii animo,</quote> <trans><tr>am disheartened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio perii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">periimus, actum est,</quote> <trans><tr>we are lost</tr>, <tr>it is all over with us</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perierat et inventus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:24:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 24, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 6</bibl>.—So, peream, si, nisi, in asseverations, <hi rend="ital">may I perish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">may I die</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if</hi> or <hi rend="ital">if not</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 183</bibl>; Cassiod. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:5:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 5, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 17, 183</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gerund</hi> and <hi rend="ital">gerundive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi illud perdo argentum, pereundum est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:53" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pereundi figurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pereundi terminus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:559" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis pereunda est probe,</quote> <trans><tr>must be lost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34869.10" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of moral qualities, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor periit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:227" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 227</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perequito: <entryFree id="n34870" type="main" key="pe^re^qui^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ĕquĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n34870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ride through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ride hither and thither</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ride about; to drive about</hi> (class. but not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n34870.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter duas acies perequitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe ex viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnes partes,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34870.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer delphino maria perequitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pererro: <entryFree id="n34871" type="main" key="pe^rerro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-erro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wander through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to roam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ramble over</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n34871.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallacem circum vespertinumque pererro Saepe forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">freta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus et fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:537" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 537</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem, Col. praef. 1: cellas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges,</quote> <trans><tr>to roam about from one king to another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3 praef.</bibl></cit> § 6.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva pererrantur Peligna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pererratus orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:234" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 234</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pererrato ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 295</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34871.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">totumque pererrat Luminibus tacitis,</quote> <trans><tr>surveys all over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus pererrat cornua, i. e. errat per tubam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:174" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 174</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pereruditus: <entryFree id="n34872" type="main" key="pe^re_ru^di_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ērŭdītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very learned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peresus: <entryFree id="n34873" type="main" key="pe^re_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrēsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from peredo.</entryFree>
perevacuo: <entryFree id="n34874" type="main" key="pe^re_va^cu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ēvăcŭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to empty quite</hi> (late Lat.), Vit. <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> 1, 4, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perexcelsus: <entryFree id="n34875" type="main" key="pe^rexcelsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-excelsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n34875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Henna, ubi ea gesta esse memorantur, est loco perexcelso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perexcrucio: <entryFree id="n34876" type="spur" key="pe^rexcru^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-excrŭcĭo</orth>, a false read. for probe excruciavero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 32</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
perexeo: <entryFree id="n34877" type="main" key="pe^rexe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-exĕo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n34877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. irr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go out through</hi>, trop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perexigue: <entryFree id="n34878" type="main" key="pe^rexi^gu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrexĭgŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perexiguus <sense id="n34878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perexiguus: <entryFree id="n34879" type="main" key="pe^rexi^gu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-exĭgŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very little</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">semen perexiguum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:32:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 32, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>very short</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et perminuta bona corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 42</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrexĭgŭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very sparingly</hi>: perexigue et <foreign lang="greek">gli/sxrws</foreign> praebere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perexilis: <entryFree id="n34880" type="main" key="pe^rexi_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-exīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very slender</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:60" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: perexile bonum est, Boëth. Cons. Phil. 2, pros. 4.</sense></entryFree>
perexoptatus: <entryFree id="n34881" type="main" key="pe^rexopta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-exoptātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatly desired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">much longed for</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in tmesi: per, inquit, exoptatus venis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perexpeditus: <entryFree id="n34882" type="spur" key="pe^rexpe^di_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-expĕdītus</orth>, a false read. for expedita, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 36</bibl>; v. Madv. ad h. l.</entryFree>
perexplicatus: <entryFree id="n34883" type="main" key="pe^rexpli^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-explĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wholly completed</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sexto reditu perexplicato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 385</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perexsiccatus: <entryFree id="n34884" type="main" key="pe^rexsicca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-exsiccātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quite dried up</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">proluvies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 230</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perextimeo: <entryFree id="n34885" type="gloss" key="pe^rexti^me^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ex-tĭmĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, and ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ex-tĭmesco</orth>, <itype>timŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n34885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fear greatly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfabrico: <entryFree id="n34886" type="main" key="perfabri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fabrĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to work</hi> or <hi rend="ital">use up;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to take in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overreach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfacete: <entryFree id="n34887" type="main" key="perfa^ce_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-făcētē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perfacetus <sense id="n34887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perfacetus: <entryFree id="n34888" type="main" key="perfa^ce_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-făcētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very witty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very facetious</hi> (class.).—Of persons, Cic <pb n="1340" /> <cb n="PERF" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Brut.</author> 27, 105</bibl>.—Of words: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid perfacetum dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 14, 35</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-făcētē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very wittily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfacete dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:46:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 46, § 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfacile: <entryFree id="n34889" type="main" key="perfa^ci^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfăcĭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perfacilis <sense id="n34889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perfacilis: <entryFree id="n34890" type="main" key="perfa^ci^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-făcĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n34890.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Very easy</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfacilis et expedita defensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 36</bibl></cit> Madv. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina cognitu perfacilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfacile factu esse conata perficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34890.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">very courteous</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfacilis in audiendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 93</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms: perfacile (class.) and ‡ perfacul. </sense><sense id="n34890.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">perfăcĭlē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n34890.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Very easily</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfacile hunc hominem de medio tolli posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:4:section=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:33:209" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 33, 209</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34890.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Very willingly</hi> (ante-class.): perfacile patior, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 5, 40</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 9 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34890.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">perfăcŭl</orth> <itype>antiqui et per se facul dicebant, quod nunc facile dicimus</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=214" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 214</bibl> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=215" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 215</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
perfacundus: <entryFree id="n34891" type="main" key="perfa_cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fācundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very eloquent</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in contionibus perfacundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfamiliaris: <entryFree id="n34892" type="main" key="perfa^mi^li^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fămĭlĭāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very intimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very familiar</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfamiliaris Philisto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11</bibl></cit> (13), 4.—In tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">Phaedon Socrati per fuit familiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:18:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34892.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perfămĭlĭāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a very intimate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">familiar friend</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:31:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 31, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Antonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:45:168" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 45, 168</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfatuus: <entryFree id="n34893" type="main" key="perfa^tu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fătŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very foolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very silly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">togae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:18:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 18, 4</bibl></cit> (al. fatuae); Aug. c. Duas Epp. Pelag. 2, 4, 7.</sense></entryFree>
perfecte: <entryFree id="n34894" type="main" key="perfecte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfectē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perficio, <sense id="n34894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perfectio: <entryFree id="n34895" type="main" key="perfecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perficio</etym>, <sense id="n34895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a finishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfecting; perfection</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc absolutionem perfectionemque in oratore desiderans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfectio atque absolutio optimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:36:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 36, 137</bibl></cit>: ad cumulum perfectionis accedere, Greg. M. Ep. 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 29, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 6, 21</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum perfectiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfectissimatus: <entryFree id="n34896" type="main" key="perfectissi^ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfectissĭmātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perfectus</etym>, <sense id="n34896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the rank and station of a</hi> perfectissimus <hi rend="ital">under the later emperors</hi> (v. <itype>perficio</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>), Cod. Th. 8, 4, 3.</sense></entryFree>
perfector: <entryFree id="n34897" type="main" key="perfector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perficio</etym>, <sense id="n34897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a finisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfecter</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mearum voluptatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 257</bibl></cit>; Scip. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfectrix: <entryFree id="n34898" type="main" key="perfectrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfectrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perfector</etym>, <sense id="n34898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that finishes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perfects</hi> (very rare): philosophia beatae vitae perfectrix, Nep. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 15, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfectus: <entryFree id="n34899" type="main" key="perfectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from perficio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34900" type="main" key="perfectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perficio</etym>, <sense id="n34900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a finishing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perfecting; perfection</hi> (very rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 20</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effects</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3, 1</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl>, prospectus is the true reading).</sense></entryFree>
perfecundus: <entryFree id="n34901" type="hapax" key="perfe_cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fēcundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">per-foec-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very fruitful</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">generatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perferens: <entryFree id="n34902" type="main" key="perfe^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfĕrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from perfero.</entryFree>
perferentia: <entryFree id="n34903" type="main" key="perfe^renti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfĕrentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perfero</etym>, <sense id="n34903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffering; endurance</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">malorum perferentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 11, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfero: <entryFree id="n34904" type="main" key="perfe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fĕro</orth>, <itype>tŭli, lātum, ferre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry through</hi> to a certain place or end. </sense><sense id="n34904.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">lapis nec pertulit ictum,</quote> <trans><tr>did not bring the blow home</tr>, <tr>did not reach the mark</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:907" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 907</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta perlata sub papillam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 803</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per arma pertulit ictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:326" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum,</quote> <trans><tr>to go the full time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 13, 11, § 58</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 11, 9, § 49</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem perferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:7" default="NO">6, 27, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneas tulit patrem per ignes, et pertulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:37:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 37, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34904.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34904.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convey</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: refero, defero): perferre mandata alicujus ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum has quam primum ad te perferri litteras vellemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui nuntium alicujus rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q.
