Fr. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:825" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 825</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: perferri, <hi rend="ital">to be brought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveyed</hi> to a person or place, <hi rend="ital">to reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come</hi>: cum ad eum fama <cb n="PERF" /> tanti exercitūs perlata esset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfertur circa collem clamor,</quote> <trans><tr>resounds round the hill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 36, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 12, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad urbem terror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34904.4" n="b" level="4"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to convey news</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to announce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">et litteris multorum et sermone omnium perfertur ad me, incredibilem tuam virtutem et fortitudinem esse,</quote> <trans><tr>I am informed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntius perfert incensas naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 665</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34904.5" n="2" level="3"> Se, <hi rend="ital">to betake one's self</hi> somewhere, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc te reginae ad limina perfer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 389</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34904.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34904.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">endure to the end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem annorum poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intrepidos ad fata novissima vultus,</quote> <trans><tr>kept</tr>, <tr>maintained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leve est miserias ferre, perferre est grave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 307" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 307</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34904.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring to an end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry out; to complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:406" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod suscepi, quoad potero, perferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:26" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum imperium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to do what one bids others do</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:250" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est utique jus vetandi, cum lex feratur, quamdiu non perfertur, Cic. Cornel. Fragm. ap. Ascon.: legem pertulit, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>carried it through</tr>, <tr>got it passed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">actionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34904.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To carry out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manage</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">patronum perferendae pro se legationis eligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34904.10" n="D" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put up with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submit to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">patior, sino, tolero): perfer, si me amas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfero et perpetior omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pati, perferre, non succumbere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigore, et fame, et siti, ac vigiliis perferendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriem, crudelitatem, avaritiam, superbiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfer et obdura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 11, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 8, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes indignitates contumeliasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 584</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34904.11" n="E" level="2"> (Like pati.) <hi rend="ital">To permit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer;</hi> with an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excindi urbes suas seque cremari pertulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achilles Cessare in Teucros pertulit arma sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 30</bibl></cit> (8, b, 14).—</sense><sense id="n34904.12" n="F" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bear the penalty of</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui peccata nostra ipse pertulit in corpore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 24.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">perfĕrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brooking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patient;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, analog. to patiens: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 184</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perferus: <entryFree id="n34905" type="main" key="perfe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very wild</hi> or <hi rend="ital">savage</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfervefio: <entryFree id="n34906" type="hapax" key="perferve^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fervĕfīo</orth>, <itype>fĭĕri</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n34906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become very hot</hi> (ante-class.).—In tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">terra sole perferve ita fit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit> dub. (acc. to Gesn. and Schneid. a gloss).</sense></entryFree>
perferveo: <entryFree id="n34907" type="main" key="perferve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fervĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n34907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be very hot</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfervet (fons),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfervidus: <entryFree id="n34908" type="spur" key="perfervi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fervĭdus</orth>, a false read. for praefervida, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5</bibl>.</entryFree>
perfica: <entryFree id="n34909" type="main" key="Perfi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Perfĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. perficus, II.</entryFree>
perficio: <entryFree id="n34910" type="main" key="perfi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, fectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>facio</etym>, <sense id="n34910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to achieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring to an end</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conclusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi> (class.; syn.: absolvo, conficio, exsequor). </sense><sense id="n34910.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitiis perficiendis undecim dies tribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis comitiis perfectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 43, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 38, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid absolvi et perfici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:13:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 30, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <trans><tr>to perpetrate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 68, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est simul et inventum et perfectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum annos,</quote> <trans><tr>to complete</tr>, <tr>live</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 39</bibl></cit>.—So of commissions, orders, <hi rend="ital">to execute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 629</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 637</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:61" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:343" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 343</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34910.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34910.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring to completion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfect</hi> (opp. inchoare): <cit><quote lang="la">candelabrum perfectum e gemmis clarissimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:28:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 28, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loricam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:403" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos ambulatione,</quote> <trans><tr>to digest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 53, 118, § 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucumeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 23, § 65</bibl></cit>: coria, <hi rend="ital">to dress</hi> or <hi rend="ital">curry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34910.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To make perfect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to perfect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem citharā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: expleta et perfecta forma honestatis, Cic. <cb n="PERF" /> Fin. 2, 15, 48: <cit><quote lang="la">artem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34910.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:9:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 9, 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfice ut putem,</quote> <trans><tr>convince me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia perfecit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,015:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ep. 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia perfecit, quae senatus salvā re publicā ne fieri possent perfecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 55</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34910.6" n="D" level="2"> In mal. part., = <foreign lang="greek">e)nergei=n</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:79:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 79, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 389</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. 4, 7</bibl>.— <orth extent="full" lang="la">perfectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">finished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exquisite</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n34910.7" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorem plenum atque perfectum esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:13:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 13, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines in dicendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfectis et absoluti philosophi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 72, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 30, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in geometriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 547</bibl></cit>.—In a religious sense, <hi rend="ital">righteous</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cor perfectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 5, 48</bibl>.—Perfectissimus, <hi rend="ital">a title of honor under the later emperors</hi>, Cod. Const. 12, tit. 33; Am. 21, 16 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 14, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34910.8" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:12:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchriora etiam Polycliti et iam plane perfecta (signa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 18, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfectum atque absolutum officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfecta cumulataque virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 40, 86</bibl></cit>: aetas, <hi rend="ital">full</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ripe age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the age of fiveand-twenty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 32</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valvae perfectiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid perfectius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 18, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:59" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad perfectiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego summum et perfectissimum judicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 31, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perfectē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfectly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">eruditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:282" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 81, 282</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatem imitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 357, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 45</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
perficus: <entryFree id="n34911" type="main" key="perfi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perficio</etym>, <sense id="n34911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">completing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfecting</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34911.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Perfĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the finishing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">completing goddess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she that perfects</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura creatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1116</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the goddess supposed to preside over sexual indulgence,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfide: <entryFree id="n34912" type="main" key="perfi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perfidus <sense id="n34912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perfidelis: <entryFree id="n34913" type="main" key="perfi^de_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fĭdēlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very trusty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very faithful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfidelis in amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 13:8" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 13, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfidens: <entryFree id="n34914" type="main" key="perfi_dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fīdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trusting greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confiding strongly</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pugnandi arte perfidens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 17" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfidia: <entryFree id="n34915" type="main" key="perfi^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfĭdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perfidus</etym>, <sense id="n34915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faithlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonesty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treachery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falsehood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfidy</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfidiā deceptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraude et perfidiā aliquem fallere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 40, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">admittere perfidiam in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfidiae tantae (fuit), ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:24" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 24</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 6</bibl>.—Of an inanim. thing: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ipsis positum labris in acoris perfidiam vinum repente mutari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfidiose: <entryFree id="n34916" type="main" key="perfi^di^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfĭdĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perfidiosus <sense id="n34916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perfidiosus: <entryFree id="n34917" type="main" key="perfi^di^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfĭdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perfidia</etym>, <sense id="n34917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faithless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treacherous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">false</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfidious</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n34917.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">fallax, perfidiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfidiosus et subdolus animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium perfidiosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:32:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 32, 80</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34917.2" n="II" level="1"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil perfidiosum et insidiosum et fallax in amicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 16</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fĭdĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">faithlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treacherously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfidiously</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hercle istam rem judicasti perfidiose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa perfidiose facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfidiose, crudeliter factum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfidiosius rebellantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfidus: <entryFree id="n34918" type="main" key="perfi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>per-fides</etym>, <sense id="n34918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that breaks his promise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faithless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">false</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treacherous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfidious.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34918.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. infidus): vanum et perfidiosum esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes, aliud agentes, aliud simulantes, perfidi, improbi, malitiosi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 14, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34918.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">gens perfida pacti,</quote> <trans><tr>faithless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34918.3" n="b" level="4"> Of inanim. and abstr. things (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:819" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 819</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nex,</quote> <trans><tr>effected by treachery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 887" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 887</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:380" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 722</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34918.4" n="c" level="4"> Adverb.: perfidum<pb n="1341" /> <cb n="PERF" />  ridens Venus (= maligne ac dolose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 67</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perfĭdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a scoundrel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:245" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 245</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:82" default="NO">9, 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34918.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">treacherous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsafe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dangerous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">freta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 302" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 570" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agam. 570</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfidum glacie flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:4:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfida et lubrica via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 49: <cit><quote lang="la">vappa,</quote> <trans><tr>wretched wine that has a good appearance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:48:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 48, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo, quoad vixerat, perfidissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perfĭ-dē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">faithlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfidiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treacherously</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfide recuperans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpere pactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:54" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:55" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod perfide gestum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:4:4:section=13" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 44, 4, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfigo: <entryFree id="n34919" type="main" key="perfi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfīgo</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pierce through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfix</hi> (only in Lucr.): multa perfigit, 6, 350.—Elsewh. only <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">perfixus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">transfixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">telis pavoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 392</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 360</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfines: <entryFree id="n34920" type="gloss" key="perfines"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfines</orth>, <itype>perfringas</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
perfingo: <entryFree id="n34921" type="gloss" key="perfingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfingo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>per-fingo</etym>, <sense id="n34921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">VARIOS AVIVM CANTVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 685</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfixus: <entryFree id="n34922" type="main" key="perfixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fixus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of perfigo, q. v.</entryFree>
perflabilis: <entryFree id="n34923" type="main" key="perfla_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perflābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perflo</etym>. <sense id="n34923.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that can be blown through.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34923.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">deos inducere perlucidos et perflabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacernae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <trans><tr>exposed to the wind</tr>, <tr>airy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 36, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34923.2" n="B" level="2"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">susceptible</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">gentes perflabiles ad omnes dissensionum motus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34923.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blowing through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domus perflabili tinnitu fidium resultantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perflagitiosus: <entryFree id="n34924" type="main" key="perfla_gi^ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-flāgĭtĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very shameful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very flagitious.</hi>—With perturpe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 20, 50</bibl> (cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:page=410" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. p. 410</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
perflagratus: <entryFree id="n34925" type="main" key="perflagra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-flagrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [flagro], <sense id="n34925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blazing greatly</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 576</bibl> Kopp.</sense></entryFree>
perflamen: <entryFree id="n34926" type="main" key="perfla_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perflāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perflo</etym>, <sense id="n34926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blowing through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a blast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breath</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 760</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perflatilis: <entryFree id="n34927" type="main" key="perfla_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perflātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be blown through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exposed to the wind</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">pator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 30, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perflatio: <entryFree id="n34928" type="main" key="perfla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perflātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blowing through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a blast</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perflatus: <entryFree id="n34929" type="main" key="perfla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perflātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blowing through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a draught</hi> of air: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—Concr., <hi rend="ital">a wind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breeze</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut perflatus aliquis accedat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca perflatum non habentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmus in perflatu firma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 40, 79, § 218</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 19, 31, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfletus: <entryFree id="n34930" type="main" key="perfle_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-flētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [fleo], in <sense id="n34930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reflex.</hi> sense. <hi rend="ital">having bewailed her case to excess</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">diutius usu perfleta (i. e. quae fleverat ex more),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perflo: <entryFree id="n34931" type="main" key="perflo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-flo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n34931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blow through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> (not in Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n34931.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum venti nubila perflant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 136</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 369</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde (nubilarium) commodissime perflari possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti terras turbine perflant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles, qui cum perflantur ipsi, tum adferunt umbram vallibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">granaria perflari undique malunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmura conchā,</quote> <trans><tr>to sound by blowing through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perflata est terra austro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 37, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34931.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blow through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:21:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 21, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perflantibus undique procellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 107, 111, § 240</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfluctuo: <entryFree id="n34932" type="hapax" key="perfluctu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fluctŭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flow through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swarm over</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">animantum copia perfluctuat artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 721</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfluo: <entryFree id="n34933" type="main" key="perflu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-flŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n34933.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">run through</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pluvialibus nimbis perfluuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 191</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34933.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34933.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34933.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To flow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">run through</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">per colum vina videmus Perfluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 392</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34933.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to flow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi in vas commoda perfluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:937" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 937</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Belus amnis in mare perfluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 65, § 190</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34933.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To drip</hi> with any thing (postclass.):<cb n="PERF" />  sudore perfluere, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 108, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34933.6" n="c" level="4"> Of long garments, <hi rend="ital">to flow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">float</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258, 30</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n34933.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: plenus rimarum sum: hac atque illac perfluo, <hi rend="ital">I leak</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I cannot keep the secret</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfluus: <entryFree id="n34934" type="main" key="perflu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perfluo</etym>, <sense id="n34934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undulating.</hi>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wanton</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">incessus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 260, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfoco: <entryFree id="n34935" type="main" key="perfo_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfōco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>per-fauces</etym>, <sense id="n34935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stifle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffocate</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">partum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:3:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 3, 4</bibl></cit> (al. praefocat).</sense></entryFree>
perfodio: <entryFree id="n34936" type="main" key="perfo^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fŏdĭo</orth>, <itype>fōdi</itype> (perfodīvi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 64</bibl> Ritschl <sense id="n34936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>), <itype>fossum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n34936.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To dig through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pierce through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfix</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">parietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: parietem, id. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:24:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 24, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athone perfosso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thorax perfossus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:522" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinā argenteā dentes,</quote> <trans><tr>to pick</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 33</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34936.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To break into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfodit in tenebris domos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 24, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:24:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 24, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34936.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make by digging through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 17, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfoecundus: <entryFree id="n34937" type="main" key="perfoecundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfoecundus</orth>, v. perfecundus.</entryFree>
perfoederatus: <entryFree id="n34938" type="gloss" key="perfoede^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfoedĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [perfoedero], <sense id="n34938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strongly leagued together</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perforaculum: <entryFree id="n34939" type="main" key="perfo^ra_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfŏrācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perforo</etym>, <sense id="n34939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a borer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an auger</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gimlet</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 200</bibl>; cf. perforaculum, <foreign lang="greek">tru/panon, te/retron</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
performido: <entryFree id="n34940" type="main" key="performi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-formīdo</orth>, no <sense id="n34940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to fear greatly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
performidolosus: <entryFree id="n34941" type="main" key="performi_do^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-formīdŏlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very fearful</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 4" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
performo: <entryFree id="n34942" type="main" key="performo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-formo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to form</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad malum performantur (al. praeformantur),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perforo: <entryFree id="n34943" type="main" key="perfo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fŏro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (in tmesi: <sense id="n34943.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">perque forare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:126:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 126, 8</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to bore through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierce through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perforate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34943.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; syn. terebro): navem, Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perforare ac demergere triremem, Auct. B. Alex. 25: lacernam lanceā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 80, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo pectora uno ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ense latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:9:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladio latus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 13, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stabianum,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut through for the sake of a prospect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo lumina perforata,</quote> <trans><tr>perforated</tr>, <tr>made by boring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae ad oculos a sede animae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">berulli perforati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 78</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part., <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 78</bibl>.—Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">habebit sinum facilem, non perforatum, ex quo multa exeant et nihil excidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Dial. 6:23:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Dial. 6, 23, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34943.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pierce through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sol perforat culmina radiis totis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:46" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfortiter: <entryFree id="n34944" type="main" key="perforti^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fortĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n34944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very bravely</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfossio: <entryFree id="n34945" type="gloss" key="perfossi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfossĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perfodio</etym>, <sense id="n34945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a digging through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perforation</hi>: perfossio, <foreign lang="greek">diorugh/, diorugmo/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
perfosso: <entryFree id="n34946" type="gloss" key="perfosso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfosso</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dig through</hi>: perfosso, <foreign lang="greek">dioru/ssw</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
perfossor: <entryFree id="n34947" type="main" key="perfossor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfossor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a digger through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breaker through</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfossor parietum,</quote> <trans><tr>a house-breaker</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 295, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfossura: <entryFree id="n34948" type="gloss" key="perfossu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfossūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a digging through</hi>: perfossura, <foreign lang="greek">diorugh/</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
perfossus: <entryFree id="n34949" type="main" key="perfossus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fossus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perfodio.</entryFree>
perfoveo: <entryFree id="n34950" type="main" key="perfo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to warm through</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfovet aegros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 134</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfractus: <entryFree id="n34951" type="main" key="perfractus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perfringo.</entryFree>
perfragrans: <entryFree id="n34952" type="main" key="perfragrans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fragrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very fragrant</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Serm. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfremo: <entryFree id="n34953" type="main" key="perfre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-frĕmo</orth>, <itype>ui, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n34953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">snort along</hi> (ante-class.): perfremunt delphini, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfrequens: <entryFree id="n34954" type="main" key="perfre^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-frĕquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very crowded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">much frequented</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emporium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfreto: <entryFree id="n34955" type="main" key="perfre^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfrĕto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>per-fretum</etym>, <sense id="n34955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sail over</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfrico: <entryFree id="n34956" type="main" key="perfri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-frĭco</orth>, <itype>cui, cātum, and ctum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n34956.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rub all over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rub</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scratch</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">caput unguento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam faciem fuligine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 51, § 190</bibl>: perfrictis oculis, App. M. <cb n="PERF" /> 2, p. 125, 28: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput sinistrā manu perfricans,</quote> <trans><tr>scratching his head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34956.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: frontem, faciem, os, <hi rend="ital">to rub one's forehead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">face</hi>, in order to make one's blushes disappear; hence, <hi rend="ital">to lay aside all sense of shame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cast off shame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summon one's assurance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put on a bold face</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum os perfricuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosa sunt illa ... perfricare faciem et quasi improbam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum perfricuit frontem posuitque pudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:27:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: perfrica frontem et dic, Calv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 25</bibl>: perfricui faciem, Plin. H. N. praef. § 4.</sense></entryFree>
perfrictio: <entryFree id="n34957" type="main" key="perfricti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfrictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perfrigesco</etym>, <sense id="n34957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a catching cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a violent cold</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 55, § 156</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:124 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 12, 76, § 124 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 57:257" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 57, 257</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34958" type="main" key="perfricti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfrictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perfrico</etym>, <sense id="n34958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abrasion</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 38, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfrictionibus cum oleo mederi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 69, § 116</bibl></cit> (but perh. the same word as the preced. in the same meaning).</sense></entryFree>
perfrictiuncula: <entryFree id="n34959" type="hapax" key="perfricti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfrictĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. perfrictio</etym>, <sense id="n34959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight cold</hi>, M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfrictus: <entryFree id="n34960" type="main" key="perfrictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfrictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perfrico.</entryFree>
perfrigefacio: <entryFree id="n34961" type="hapax" key="perfri_ge^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfrīgĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>per-frigefacto</etym>, <sense id="n34961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make very cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to benumb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi perfrigefacit cor Surus,</quote> <trans><tr>strikes a chill to my heart</tr>, <tr>makes me shudder with fear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfrigeo: <entryFree id="n34962" type="gloss" key="perfri_ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-frīgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n34962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take cold</hi>: perfrigeo, <foreign lang="greek">katayu/xw</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
perfrigero: <entryFree id="n34963" type="main" key="perfri_ge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-frīgĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n34963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to make cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cool off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let grow cold</hi> (postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 271" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 271</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfrigesco: <entryFree id="n34964" type="main" key="perfri_gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-frīgesco</orth>, <itype>frixi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n34964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34964.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow very cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to catch cold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne canes perfrigescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 33, § 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei, qui perfrixit, opus est in laconico sedere, donec insudet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si perfrixit, cantat bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:194" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 194</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34964.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (post-class.), M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfrigidus: <entryFree id="n34965" type="main" key="perfri_gi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-frīgĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very cold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfringo: <entryFree id="n34966" type="main" key="perfringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfringo</orth>, <itype>frēgi, fractum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>perfrango</etym>, <sense id="n34966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dash in pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shatter</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n34966.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34966.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">elephanto pugno perfregisti bracchium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta ingredientia nivem ... jactandis gravius in connitendo ungulis penitus perfringebant,</quote> <trans><tr>broke through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 36, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxo perfracto capite,</quote> <trans><tr>his skull fractured by a stroke of a stone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora fulvo protecta capillo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfracto saxo sortes erupisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympum fulmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 12, 14, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves perfregerant proras, litori illisas,</quote> <trans><tr>had been wrecked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34966.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">burst through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to force one's way through</hi> any obstacle: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium phalangem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:362" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos,</quote> <trans><tr>to break into</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34966.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34966.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To break through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infringe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decreta senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 32, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac prosternere omnia cupiditate ac furore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34966.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">burst through</hi>: omnia repagula juris, pudoris et officii perfringere. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:15:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 15, § 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfringere et labefactare tantam conspirationem bonorum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos suavitate,</quote> <trans><tr>to affect powerfully</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 38</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (eloquentia) modo perfringit, modo irrepit in sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfrio: <entryFree id="n34967" type="main" key="perfri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-frĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to crumble up</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">bacas myrti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 38, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfrivolus: <entryFree id="n34968" type="main" key="perfri_vo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-frīvŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very worthless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very frivolous</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfructio: <entryFree id="n34969" type="main" key="perfructi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fructĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">perfruĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perfruor</etym>, <sense id="n34969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">complete enjoyment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fruition</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfructio summi et veri boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quant. Anim. 33" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quant. Anim. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine perfruitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trin. 6, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfructus: <entryFree id="n34970" type="main" key="perfructus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fructus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perfruor.</entryFree>
perfruitio: <entryFree id="n34971" type="main" key="perfru^i^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfrŭĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. perfructio.</entryFree>
perfruor: <entryFree id="n34972" type="main" key="perfru^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-frŭor</orth>, <itype>ctus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <sense id="n34972.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <pb n="1342" /> <cb n="PERF" /> <hi rend="ital">enjoy fully</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thoroughly</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n34972.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">his ego rebus pascor, his delector, his perfruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvā re publicā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae laude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitā modicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recordatione urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:101:3 al" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 101, 3 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoenitate summā perfructus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Hort. p. 484</bibl></cit> Orell.—</sense><sense id="n34972.2" n="(b)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad perfruendas voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34972.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fulfil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mandatis perfruar ipsa patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfuga: <entryFree id="n34973" type="main" key="perfu^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfŭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perfugio</etym>, <sense id="n34973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deserter</hi> to the enemy (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfugam Gallus Aelius ait, qui liber aut servus aut hostis suā voluntate ad hostes transierit: qui idem dicitur transfuga. Quamquam sunt, qui credant, perfugam esse, non tam qui alios fugiat, quam qui ob spem commodorum ad quempiam perfugiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=214" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 214</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">iste, qui initio proditor fuit, deinde perfuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 117</bibl></cit>; Crass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:66:223" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 66, 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfuga ab eo (Pyrrho) venit in castra Fabricii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:22:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 22, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de perfugis gravius, quam de fugitivis consultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:13" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 25, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfugio: <entryFree id="n34974" type="main" key="perfu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fŭgĭo</orth>, <itype>fūgi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n34974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flee</hi> to a place for refuge. </sense><sense id="n34974.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34974.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare; ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 89</bibl>, profugisti is the correct reading.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">confugio): ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corinthum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bactra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tribunal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Capitolium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34974.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to go over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">desert</hi> to the enemy (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nemo a Caesare ad Pompeium transierat, cum paene cotidie a Pompeio ad Caesarem perfugerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 9, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos, qui ad eos perfugissent (al. profugissent), poposcit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34974.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take refuge</hi> in any thing (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum in culpā et in maleficio revicti sunt, perfugiunt ad fati necessitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fidem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
