perfugium: <entryFree id="n34975" type="main" key="perfu^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfŭgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perfugio</etym>, <sense id="n34975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place to flee to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shelter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">asylum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuge</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfugi sibi copiam comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si unum ostium obsideatur, aliud perfugium petat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit> Bothe: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus perfugium peperit,</quote> <trans><tr>ran off</tr>, <tr>escaped</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum propter siccitates paludum, quo se reciperent, non haberent, quo perfugio superiore anno fuerant usi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portum ac perfugium esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfugium et praesidium salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfugium unum, una spes reliqua est Roscio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desperatissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:41:section=101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 41, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfugium omnium laborum et sollicitudinum somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 72, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Campania</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 8, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfulcio: <entryFree id="n34976" type="main" key="perfulci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fulcĭo</orth>, <itype>fulsi, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prop up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sustain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">eloquio perfulcire senatum (al. permulcire), Auct. Pan. ad Pis. 86: perfulsit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfulgerat: <entryFree id="n34977" type="gloss" key="perfulge^rat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fulgĕrat</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fulgŭrat</orth>), <sense id="n34977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it flashes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gleams brightly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfunctio: <entryFree id="n34978" type="main" key="perfuncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfunctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perfungor</etym>, <sense id="n34978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a performing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharging</hi> of an office (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">honorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: laborum, <hi rend="ital">an undergoing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enduring</hi> (along with perpessio dolorum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 15, 49</bibl>.—Of things: annua fertur ei totius spatii esse perfunctio, Ambros. Hexaëm. 4, 5, 24.</sense></entryFree>
perfunctorie: <entryFree id="n34979" type="main" key="perfuncto_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfunctōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perfunctorius <sense id="n34979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perfunctorius: <entryFree id="n34980" type="main" key="perfuncto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfunctōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perfunctus; despatched, i. e.</etym>, <sense id="n34980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">done in a careless</hi> or <hi rend="ital">superficial manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfunctory</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">examinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:Val. 3" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> Val. 3</bibl></cit>, Postul. 2, 11, c. l. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: genitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 37, § 37</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-functōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfunctorily</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">me coepit non perfunctorie verberare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 11</bibl></cit>: facere aliquid, Cod. Th. 12, 3, 2; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 14, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfunctus: <entryFree id="n34981" type="main" key="perfunctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perfungor.</entryFree>
perfundo: <entryFree id="n34982" type="main" key="perfundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fundo</orth>, <itype>fūdi, fūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besprinkle</hi> (class.; syn.: umecto, aspergo, imbuo). </sense><sense id="n34982.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquā ferventi Philodamus perfunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluviis pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 445</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges flumine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfusus liquidis odoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: postquam perfusus est, <hi rend="ital">had bathed</hi>, <cb n="PERF" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis perfusus aquā frigidā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:77" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces olivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 115</bibl></cit>; so, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurorae lacrimis perfusus,</quote> <trans><tr>living far in the East</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:332" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfundi nardo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves hic perfunduntur,</quote> <trans><tr>bathe themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 14, § 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34982.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34982.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pour into</hi> any thing (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sextarios musti in vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:24:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 24, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34982.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to flow out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to knock out</hi> an eye (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut oculus puero perfunderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:5:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 5, § 3</bibl></cit> dub. (al. perfodere or effundere).—</sense><sense id="n34982.5" n="3" level="3"> Of perspiration or of streams, <hi rend="ital">to pour</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flow over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bathe</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ossaque et artus Perfundit toto proruptus corpore sudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot amnium fontiumque ubertas totam Italiam perfundens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venafrano (oleo) piscem perfundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:86" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34982.6" n="4" level="3"> Of garments, <hi rend="ital">to steep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dye</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ostro Perfusae vestes,</quote> <trans><tr>steeped in purple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34982.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To scatter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sprinkle over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to besprinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestrew</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">canitiem immundo perfusam pulvere turpans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine currum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penates sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lethaeo perfusa papavera somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scena perfusa croco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 416</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34982.8" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cover</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">omne genus perfusa coloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:821" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 821</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auro tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 115:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 115, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes amictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:33:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 33, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34982.9" n="7" level="3"> Of the sun's beams or fire, <hi rend="ital">to flood</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fill</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">sol perfundens omnia luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 148</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 215</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum plurimo sole perfunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campos lumine (facis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:558" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 558</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34982.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34982.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To imbue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill</hi> with any thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad perfundendum animum tamquam illiquefactae voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus jucunditate quādam perfunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus dulcedine omni quasi perfusi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di immortales, qui me horror perfudit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34982.12" n="2" level="3"> In partic., to fill with the apprehension of any thing, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alarm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos judicio perfundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora bello rapido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:301" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 301</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Mars) perfusus pectora tempestate belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:228" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 228</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34982.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To imbue slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make superficially acquainted</hi> with any thing (the fig. being borrowed from dyeing; <cit><quote lang="la">post-Aug.): perseveret perbibere liberalia studia, non illa, quibus perfundi satis est, sed haec, quibus tingendus est animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 36:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 36, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">acceperit: si illā (notitiā) se non perfuderit, sed infecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 110:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 110, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfungor: <entryFree id="n34983" type="main" key="perfungor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fungor</orth>, <itype>functus</itype>, <sense id="n34983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34983.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fulfil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharge</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n34983.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">munere quodam necessitatis, et gravi opere perfungimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 21, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoribus amplissimis et laboribus maximis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae muneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus amplissimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34983.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (post-Aug.): onera quaestoria perfunctus est, Front. Ep. ad Verum, 7.—</sense><sense id="n34983.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34983.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undergo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure; to get through with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get rid of.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34983.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula, quibus nos perfuncti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:18:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:982" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 982</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34983.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> (ante-class.): sues perfunctas esse a febri, et a foriā, <hi rend="ital">are free from</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 5</bibl>.—(Others omit the prep. <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>）— </sense><sense id="n34983.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timorem illum satis inanem perfuncti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia perfunctus vitai praemia marces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:956" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 956</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">zeugma multa pro aliquo perpessus atque perfunctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34983.9" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam perfunctus sum, explevi animos invidorum,</quote> <trans><tr>I have gone through it</tr>, <tr>have stood it out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:17:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 17, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judices, quod se perfunctos jam esse arbitrantur, cum de reo judicarunt, neglegentius attendunt cetera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:41:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 41, 116</bibl></cit>.—In a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria perfuncti periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34983.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To enjoy</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n34983.11" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: omnibus bonis, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 227</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34983.12" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum aetas tempus tulit, perfuncta satis sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfuro: <entryFree id="n34984" type="main" key="perfu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fŭro</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n34984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rage through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run furiously through</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>) </sense><sense id="n34984.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eoas domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:388" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 388</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34984.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rage furiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rage on</hi>: incensus et <cb n="PERG" /> ipse Perfurit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 343</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita perfurit acri Cum fremitu ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 275</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfuse: <entryFree id="n34985" type="hapax" key="perfu_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfūsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>perfundo</etym>, <sense id="n34985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">profusely</hi>: perfuse atque abunde sparsa vasa, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 516, 31</bibl> (al. profuse).</sense></entryFree>
perfusio: <entryFree id="n34986" type="main" key="perfu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-fūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n34986.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a pouring over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wetting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moistening</hi> (post-Aug.). perfusio corporis ex aquā calidā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 14, § 74</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">alarum perfusiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 9, 82, § 164</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34986.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">baptism</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 15, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perfusor: <entryFree id="n34987" type="gloss" key="perfu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfūsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who pours water over another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bath-servant</hi>, who poured water over the bathers (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl>), Inscr. Pompei. ap. Bullet. Napolit. II. 1843, p. 3, and v. Avellino, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 67</bibl>; cf.: perfusor, <foreign lang="greek">perixu/ths, prosxu/ths</foreign>, Gloss. Cyrill.</sense></entryFree>
perfusorie: <entryFree id="n34988" type="main" key="perfu_so_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfūsōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perfusorius <sense id="n34988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perfusorius: <entryFree id="n34989" type="main" key="perfu_so_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfūsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perfundo</etym>, <sense id="n34989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">merely wetting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moistening;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n34989.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Slight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superficial</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis et perfusoria voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 23:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 23, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34989.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Disturbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrongful</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">assertio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">perfūsōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superficially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cursorily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indefinitely</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfusorie dicere, aut denuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:24:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:69" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 21, 2, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perfusus: <entryFree id="n34990" type="main" key="perfu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">perfūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perfundo.</entryFree>
pergama: <entryFree id="n34991" type="main" key="Perga^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergăma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergămum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pergămon</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pe/rgama</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*pe/rgamon</foreign>, <sense id="n34991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the citadel of Troy</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Troy</hi>: Pergama, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 512, 32</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 2 Rib.); Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Trag. v. 98 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 476</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 651</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">571</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 445</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">591</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 169</bibl> et saep.: Pergamo, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:21:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 21, 42</bibl>; Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 280, 27</bibl>: Pergamum (<case>acc.</case>), Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 26, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 2</bibl>; (<case>nom.</case>) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 419" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 419</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Troad. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pergamon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34991.1" n="B" level="2"> Lavinia Pergama, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Lavinium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:64" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 64</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n34991.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergămĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 744</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cassandra</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 51.—</sense><sense id="n34991.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Roman</hi> (on account of the descent of the Romans from the Trojans): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:47" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pergamenus: <entryFree id="n34992" type="main" key="Perga^me_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergămēnus</orth>, v. 2. Pergamum, A.</entryFree>
pergameus: <entryFree id="n34993" type="main" key="Perga^me^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergămĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Pergama, II., and 2. Pergamum, B.</entryFree>
pergamis: <entryFree id="n34994" type="main" key="Perga^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergămis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n34994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pergamum: <entryFree id="n34995" type="main" key="Perga^mum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergămum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. Pergama.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34996" type="main" key="Perga^mum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergămum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n34996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Mysia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Caystrus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the residence of the Attalian kings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a celebrated library</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bergamo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:19" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes">20 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34996.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergămēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pergamhno/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pergamum in Mysia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pergamean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pergamena civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 30, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 11, 5</bibl></cit>.—Pergamena charta, or as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergămēna</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergămīna</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 124</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">parchment</hi>, a material for writing on, prepared from the skins of animals, invented by Eumenes, king of Pergamum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 7</bibl>, n. 2; cf. Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 11, 21, § 70</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergămēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country about Pergamum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 126</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergămēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Pergamum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Pergameans</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 30, 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34996.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergămĕ-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Pergamum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pergamean</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): deus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Æsculapius</hi> (who was worshipped at Pergamum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:17:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 17, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34997" type="main" key="Perga^mum3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergămum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n34997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Creta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founded by Agamemnon</hi> (or acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 133</bibl>, by Æneas), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pergaudeo: <entryFree id="n34998" type="main" key="pergaude^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-gaudĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n34998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rejoice greatly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trebonium meum a te amari pergaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pergenitus: <entryFree id="n34999" type="main" key="perge^ni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-gĕnĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">engendered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produced</hi> (late Lat.), Pelag. Vet. 11.</sense></entryFree>
perglisco: <entryFree id="n35000" type="main" key="perglisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-glisco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become quite fat</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">gallina pergliscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pergnarus: <entryFree id="n35001" type="main" key="pergna_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-gnārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has a thorough knowledge of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is very experienced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well versed in</hi> any thing (very rare): locorum pergnari, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 554, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 290, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pergo: <entryFree id="n35002" type="main" key="pergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pergo</orth>, <itype>perrexi, perrectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>per-rego</etym>. <sense id="n35002.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35002.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> <pb n="1343" /> <cb n="PERG" /> <hi rend="ital">on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi> with any thing (esp. a motion), <hi rend="ital">to pursue with energy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosecute vigorously</hi> (v. Mütz. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 7</bibl>; rare, and in Cic. only with an <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>). </sense><sense id="n35002.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergam, quo coepi, hoc iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 5</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Afr. 69; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35002.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confestim ad eum ire perreximus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perge igitur ordine quattuor mihi istas partes explicare,</quote> <trans><tr>proceed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Victumvias oppugnandas ire pergit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:57:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 57, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergit ire sequentibus paucis in hospitium Metelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:53:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 53, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal postquam ipsi sententia stetit pergere ire,</quote> <trans><tr>to go on with his march</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere viam quam instituisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 14:42" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum exsolvere pergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:932" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 932</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergitin' pergere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35002.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non potest ad similitudinem pergi rei, quae necdum est,</quote> <trans><tr>one cannot attain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 7, 16, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35002.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n35002.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To wake up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arouse</hi> a person: pergere dicebant expergefacere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=215" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 215</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n35002.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To proceed with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertake</hi> a thing (post-Aug.): prospere cessura quae pergerent, si, etc., <hi rend="ital">their enterprise would succeed if</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 28</bibl> dub. (al. ad quae pergerent, al. quo pergerent, v. Orell. ad h. l.).—</sense><sense id="n35002.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to proceed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word; syn.: progredior, proficiscor). </sense><sense id="n35002.9" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">horsum pergunt,</quote> <trans><tr>they are coming this way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis hic est, qui huc pergit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eādem viā pergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 54, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Macedoniam ad Planciumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 41, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advorsum hostes, in solitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 74:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 74, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 71:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 71, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obviam alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to go to meet</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 51, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:171" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsonatum pergam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 154</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: ad plebem pergitur, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 513, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35002.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pass on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi> to any thing (esp. an action), <hi rend="ital">to go after</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">pergamus ad reliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:43:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 43, 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35002.11" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in speaking. </sense><sense id="n35002.12" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To go on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergam atque insequar longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:20:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 20, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perge de Caesare,</quote> <trans><tr>go on and relate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:258" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 74, 258</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 10, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pergis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35002.13" n="b" level="4"> Of one who has not yet spoken, <hi rend="ital">to begin and go on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to proceed</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pergite, Pierides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pergracilis: <entryFree id="n35003" type="main" key="pergra^ci^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-grăcĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very slender</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">caulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 101, § 159</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pergraecor: <entryFree id="n35004" type="main" key="pergraecor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-graecor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n35004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to live just like the Greeks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to play the Greek</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to revel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carouse</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut cum solo pergraecetur milite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">64</bibl>: pergraecari est epulis et potationibus inservire, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=215" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 215</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pergrandesco: <entryFree id="n35005" type="main" key="pergrandesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-grandesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n35005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow very large</hi> (ante-class.), Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 115, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pergrandis: <entryFree id="n35006" type="main" key="pergrandis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-grandis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very great</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergrandis natu,</quote> <trans><tr>very old</tr>, <tr>very aged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 29, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Josue, 24, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pergraphicus: <entryFree id="n35007" type="main" key="pergra^phi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-grăphĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very skilful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very artful</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sycophanta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pergratus: <entryFree id="n35008" type="main" key="pergra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-grātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very pleasant</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:6:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 6, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id mihi pergratum perque jucundum erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>, § 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergratum mihi feceris, si,</quote> <trans><tr>you would do me a great pleasure</tr>, <tr>a great favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—In tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">per mihi, per, inquam, gratum feceris, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 20, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pergravis: <entryFree id="n35009" type="main" key="pergra^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-grăvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very weighty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very important</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pergravia (haec), opp. levia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 50, 107</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pergrăvĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very gravely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very seriously</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pergraviter offensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehendere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 227</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pergula: <entryFree id="n35010" type="main" key="pergu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pergŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pergo; cf. tegula, from tego</etym>. <sense id="n35010.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A projection</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shed</hi> in front of a house, used as <hi rend="ital">a booth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shop; of an exchanger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 6, § 8</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of a paintingroom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">studio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 84</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35010.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A shop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 19</bibl>.— <cb n="PERH" /> </sense><sense id="n35010.2" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A school</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lecture-room</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mathematici pergula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pergulā docuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergulae magistrales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Sat. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui cedere debeat omnis Pergula,</quote> <trans><tr>the whole school</tr>, <tr>all the scholars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:137" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 137</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35010.3" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A brothel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:5:70" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 5, 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35010.4" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A vine-arbor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2" default="NO">11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35010.5" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A hut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hovel</hi> (opp. aedes): <cit><quote lang="la">in pergulā natus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pergulana: <entryFree id="n35011" type="main" key="pergu^la_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pergŭlāna</orth>, <itype>vitis</itype> <etym>pergula</etym>, <sense id="n35011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vine trained over an arbor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pergus: <entryFree id="n35012" type="main" key="Pergus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pergus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake in Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the city of Enna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Pluto is said to have carried off Proserpine</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Lago Pergusa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 386</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pergustus: <entryFree id="n35013" type="main" key="pergustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per-gustus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">taste</hi> (late Lat.): severi, Epist. Jud. Minor. Conv. p. 830, t. 41 Migne.</sense></entryFree>
perhaurio: <entryFree id="n35014" type="main" key="pe^rhauri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-haurĭo</orth>, <itype>si, stum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n35014.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to drain completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drink up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calicem uno haustu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 246, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35014.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">auribus perhauriendum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perhaustus: <entryFree id="n35015" type="main" key="pe^rhaustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrhaustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perhaurio.</entryFree>
perhibeo: <entryFree id="n35016" type="main" key="pe^rhi^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-hĭbĕo</orth>, <itype>ui, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>habeo</etym>, <sense id="n35016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hold out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afford; to attribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assign</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n35016.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (mostly ante-class. and post-Aug.; cf.: edo, exhibeo): operam rei publicae fortem atque strenuam, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnanimitatis exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 25, 26, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonium,</quote> <trans><tr>to bear witness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:127" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 38, 39, § 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut testimonium perhiberet de lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 10, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 10, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in causā universorum creditorum, qui sine eo, quem Caecilius suo nomine perhiberet, facile causam communem sustinerent,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring forward</tr>, <tr>furnish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam auctoritatem huic animali perhibet Nigidius,</quote> <trans><tr>attributes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui rei palmam,</quote> <trans><tr>to give the preference</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (Vettonicae) tanta vis perhibetur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 8, 55, § 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:104" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 11, 26, § 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut rebus praecipuis honos in primis perhibeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 1, 9, § 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35016.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to say</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assert</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to call</hi>, <hi rend="ital">name</hi> any thing (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; in Cic. very rare, perh. only three times; cf. Madv. Opusc. Acad. p. 200, and ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:page=163" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. p. 163</bibl>): vento quem perhibent Graium genus aëra linguā, Enn. ap. Prob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl> (Ann. v. 149 Vahl.); cf.: id quod nostri caelum memorant, Grai perhibent aethera, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 17</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 71 Rib.): est locus Hesperiam quam mortales perhibebant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 23 Vahl.): omnes corde patrem perhibent, id. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 39</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> v. 460</bibl> ib.): Jove propagatus est, ut perhibent, Tantalus, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 57</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ut perhibent viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Electrā, ut Graii perhibent, Atlantide cretus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 135</bibl></cit>: bene qui coniciet, vatem hunc perhibebo optimum, Cic. poët. Div. 2, 5, 12.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: fortunam insanam esse perhibent philosophi, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 22, 36</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 104 Rib.).—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: sophiam sapientia quae perhibetur, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=325" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 325</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 227 Vahl.): sane ego me nolo fortem perhiberi virum, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis me inprobior perhibeatur esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Trin. 3:2:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes, qui esse aurei perhibentur,</quote> <trans><tr>are said to be</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Stich. 1:1:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyndaridae fratres, qui nuntii fuisse perhibentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his (Romulus) dicitur ... perhibetur ceteris praestitisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec minus est Spartiates Agesilaus ille perhibendus,</quote> <trans><tr>to be named</tr>, <tr>cited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perhibitus: <entryFree id="n35017" type="main" key="pe^rhi^bi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrhĭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perhibeo.</entryFree>
perhiemo: <entryFree id="n35018" type="main" key="pe^rhi^e^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-hĭĕmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-hyĕmo</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n35018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to winter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass the winter; to lie</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remain all winter</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perhilum: <entryFree id="n35019" type="hapax" key="pe^rhi_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-hīlum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n35019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very little</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 576</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perhonestus: <entryFree id="n35020" type="main" key="pe^rho^nestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-hŏnestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very honorable</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perhonorifice: <entryFree id="n35021" type="main" key="pe^rho^no_ri^fi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrhŏnōrĭfĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perhonorificus <sense id="n35021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perhonorificus: <entryFree id="n35022" type="main" key="pe^rho^no_ri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-hŏnōrĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n35022.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That</hi> <cb n="PERI" /> <hi rend="ital">does one much honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very honorable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">con salutatio forensis perhonorifica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2</bibl></cit>. 18, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">discessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 19, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35022.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That shows much honor to another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very respectful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collega in me perhonorificus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrhŏnōrĭfĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very respectfully</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perhorreo: <entryFree id="n35023" type="main" key="pe^rhorre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-horrĕo</orth>, <itype>ui, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n35023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tremble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shudder greatly at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have a great horror of</hi> any thing (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">horum tela perhorrebimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 2, 9</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
perhorresco: <entryFree id="n35024" type="main" key="pe^rhorresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-horresco</orth>, <itype>rui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n35024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35024.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tremble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shudder greatly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">toto corpore perhorresco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recordatione consulatūs vestri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore perhorruit Aetne,</quote> <trans><tr>trembled</tr>, <tr>shook</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:877" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 877</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latumque perhorruit aequor (ventorum jactatibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:704" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 704</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35024.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shudder greatly at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have a great horror of</hi> any thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc tantam religionem non perhorrescis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexationem virginum Vestalium perhorresco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bosporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perhorridus: <entryFree id="n35025" type="main" key="pe^rhorri^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-horrĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very dreadful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frightful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most horrid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna perhorrida situ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perhumaniter: <entryFree id="n35026" type="main" key="pe^rhu_ma_ni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-hūmānĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. perhumanus <sense id="n35026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perhumanus: <entryFree id="n35027" type="main" key="pe^rhu_ma_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-hūmānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very courteous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very polite</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 12</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrhūmānĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very kindly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very politely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perhyemo: <entryFree id="n35028" type="main" key="pe^rhye^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-hyĕmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. perhiemo.</entryFree>
perialogos: <entryFree id="n35029" type="main" key="Pe^ri^a^lo^gos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrĭălŏgos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peria/logos</foreign>, <sense id="n35029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">The Very Unreasonable</hi> (sc. father), <hi rend="ital">the title of a work by Orbilius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 9</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
periambus: <entryFree id="n35030" type="main" key="pe^ri^ambus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭambus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n35030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">A metrical foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of two short syllaoles</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">usually called a pyrrhichius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
periander: <entryFree id="n35031" type="main" key="Pe^ri^ander"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrĭander</orth>, <itype>dri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*peri/andros</foreign>, <sense id="n35031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Cypselus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a king of Corinth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and one of the seven wise men of Greece</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:19:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 19, 4</bibl>; Aus. Lud. Sept. Sapient. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 221" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 221</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
periboetos: <entryFree id="n35032" type="main" key="pe^ri^bo^e_tos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭbŏētos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peribo/htos</foreign>, <sense id="n35032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cried up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">celebrated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peribolus: <entryFree id="n35033" type="main" key="pe^ri^bo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭbŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peri/bolos</foreign>, <sense id="n35033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the circuit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclosure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exterior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 42, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit>. Macc. 14, 48.</sense></entryFree>
peribomius: <entryFree id="n35034" type="main" key="Pe^ri^bo_mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrĭbōmĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a shameless person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pericarpum: <entryFree id="n35035" type="greek" key="pe^ri^carpum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭcarpum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peri/karpon</foreign>, <sense id="n35035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bulbous plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 82, § 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perichristarion: <entryFree id="n35036" type="greek" key="pe^richrista_ri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrichristārĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peri/xristos</foreign>, <sense id="n35036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of eye-salve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Emp. 8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Emp. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perichyte: <entryFree id="n35037" type="greek" key="pe^ri^chy^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrĭchytē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">perixuth/</foreign>, <sense id="n35037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of gladiatorial combat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an enclosing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enveloping</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 43, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pericles: <entryFree id="n35038" type="main" key="Pe^ri_^cles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕrī^cles</orth>, <itype>is and i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*periklh=s</foreign>, <sense id="n35038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous Athenian orator and statesman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 15, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 137</bibl> et saep.; <case>voc.</case> Pericle, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40, 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
periclitabundus: <entryFree id="n35039" type="main" key="pe^ri_cli^ta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrīclĭtābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>periclitor</etym>, <sense id="n35039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">making a trial</hi> or <hi rend="ital">essay</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n35039.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puncto pollicis extremam aciem (sagittae) periclitabunda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 168, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 308, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35039.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 138, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
periclitatio: <entryFree id="n35040" type="hapax" key="pe^ri_cli^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrīclĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experiment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid usu et periclitatione percipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:161" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 161</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
periclitor: <entryFree id="n35041" type="main" key="pe^ri_cli^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrīclĭtor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (periclitatus, in <sense id="n35041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>periculum</etym>. </sense><sense id="n35041.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35041.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to try</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">test</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to make a trial of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put to the test</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: experior, tento): periclitatus animum sum tuum, quid faceres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Am 3, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an periclitamini Quid animi habeam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli fortunam tentare ac periclitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:50:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 50, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 31, 96</bibl></cit>: fidem alicujus. <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in periclitandis experiundisque pueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 46, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periclitandae vires ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exerceri in rebus cominus noscendis periclitandisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35041.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to put in peril</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to endanger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">risk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jeopard</hi> (rare but class.): non est saepius in uno homine salus summa periclitanda rei publicae, Cic. <pb n="1344" /> <cb n="PERI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 1, 5, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35041.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35041.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To try</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make an attempt</hi> (class.): periclitari volui, si, etc., Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotidie quid nostri auderent, periclitabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:18:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 18, 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35041.6" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to venture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be bold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enterprising</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">proeliis et periclitando tuti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35041.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be in danger</hi> or <hi rend="ital">peril</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to incur</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be exposed to danger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be endangered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imperilled</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut potius Gallorum vita quam legionariorum periclitaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 33</bibl></cit>: ne de summā imperii populus Romanus periclitetur, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35041.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">famā ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capite,</quote> <trans><tr>to have one's head in danger</tr>, <tr>be in danger of losing one's head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:26:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 37, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paralysi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 15, 59, § 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causā,</quote> <trans><tr>to be on trial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35041.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <trans><tr>to be in peril of one's life</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 216, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35041.10" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">periclitabatur totam paene tragoediam evertere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 69, § 112</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab obtrectatore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 14, 29.—With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro veritate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 14, 29.—With <hi rend="ital">propter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter te cotidie,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 14, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">propter peccatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 30, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">periclitantes ex canis rabiosi morsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 5, 19, § 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35041.11" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: ut verba non periclitentur, <hi rend="ital">that the words may run no danger</hi> (of losing the cause), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 17</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrīclĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">part. perf.;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">tried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tested</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">periclitatis moribus amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
